I enjoy all kind of sports, specially racquet such as squash and tenis and also love swimming.

I am always in the mood for having an interesting conversation, laughing, going to a party, having a barbeque, going to the movies, meeting cool new people and showing the beautiful areas near us such as San Angel, Coyoacan and UNAM.

Our place is very convenient for international as well as local students attending UNAM or ITAM that require a friendly, safe, super clean and excellent located home.

Beautiful and practically* independent rooftop studio with its own little kitchen (basic stove, sink, and small refrigerator), private bathroom and terrace. Two exterior stairs led you to the rooftop.
*The studio is located in the rooftop of our house, so you cross through the main house.
We are located in San Miguel Chapultepec, a beautiful neighborhood next to Chapultepec Park and Condesa, near 2 subway stations, bike lanes, and metrobus.

The space
The studio has its own bathroom and kitchen with a small coffeemaker. The small terrace is perfect to read or have a breakfast /meal/dinner and have a awesome time after a long day walking around the city.

Guest access
The studio has its own terrace and the rooftop is a common area that you can use.

Other things to note
The street is quiet during the weekends and a little busy during weekdays. The studio is nice and quiet during night and with a lot of sun duri

name: Bright Roma Condo & Private Terrace
description:
Located in the middle of the magic of la Roma. You will find a comftable two bedroom apartment, with an open terrace in one of the most charming neighborhoods in MÃ©xico city, with natural light. Fully equipped kitchen and two bathrooms. Ideal for a unique and unforgettable travel experience. With 24 hour security service.

The space
First floor apartment where you will enjoy a comfortable moment resting on our contemporary green sofa on the living room which connects to a large private terrace with a table and bench for coffee mornings or just read your favorite book.
A well designed kitchen with a bar

neiborhood_overview: Soak up the character of La Roma by visiting cool bars, stores, cultural centers, churches, galleries, and some of the country's best restaurants. Many are housed in majestic French-style former mansions from the Porfiriato period. This is where Beat writers William S Burroughs and Jack Kerouac naturally gravitated during their 1950s sojourn in Mexico City.

name: Modern Mexico City apartment @ historic district
description:
Fully equipped modern apartment in a superb location at one of the most centric spots in Mexico City at the edge of the historic district and modern Mexico City within walking distance to major museums and landmarks as well as access to the citywide transportation system. It is ideal for a weekend getaway to experience Mexico City or to attend business.

The space
Fully equipped modern decoration apartment with superb location in one of the safest most central spots in the city at the frontier of the Aztec empire and modern Mexico City just blocks away from historic district and right next to major museums and landmarks at the business district. Location is ideal to visit both old Mexico (Bellas Artes Museum, Chapultepec) as well as modern (Polanco and Reforma avenue) and art districts (Condesa and Roma). Short walking distance from subway and public transportation including city tour bus to the rest of the city as well as various restaurants and bars.
host_about:
Born in Mexico City, Iâve spent my life living in many places and currently enjoying South Florida.  Iâm a father to two lovely girls and husband to exceptional woman, passionate traveler in constant pursuit of happiness and adventure.  We love to travel and see new places, including beautiful cities to explore or sunny places with warm weather where to play in the water. Aside from great food and adventure, we love hosting fellow travelers in our properties that we designed in unique handpicked locations.  We strive to make the hosting experience beautiful, safe and stylish at an affordable price so that people that stay at our place can make the most of their trip.

Northeast is Mexico Cityâs âHistoric Districtâ which dates back to the 13th century Aztec Empire and thru the Spanish 16th century colonial age. At the Zocalo plaza, just a few streets east of the apartment, you will find the remains of the Aztec emperor Moctezumaâs temple next to the National Palace, the official government residence that thrives with artist Diego Riveraâs murals and the monumental Cathedral built on top of the pagan temple, symbol of Mexican religious devotion and Spanish conquest. As you walk thru the streets of the district you will experience centuries of history along with live shows, people dressed in traditional outfits, original architecture and amazing cuisine.

name: CONDESA - Home away from home!
description:
Ideal opportunity to stay at a classic Mexican style home located in one of the trendiest neighborhoods in town while living the unique home sharing Airbnb experience. Just a few street blocks from all convenient services: public transportation, the hop on/hop off tourist bus, neighborhood cafes and clubs, landmarks, supermarkets, bakeries, shops, and parks. We also offer airport pickups and a variety of safe, convenient and tailored door to door bilingual tours. Live Mexico city to the full!!

The space
Our home is welcoming, friendly and very respectful of your relaxation time. Best place to stay after a busy day.
The place is big enough for comfortable and independent home sharing. My partner and I live in a separated section of the same house, and we offer two independent and comfortable private bedrooms that include their own private bathrooms and the use of common areas. I will always be ready to assist you when required.
At home, we can comforta
host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home.  Leo and I will be glad to share our place with you during your visit to Mexico City, and make you feel at home. We really like meeting people from all cardinal points. We have travelled to different countries and this is why we understand what you need. Leo is a dentist and I am a business consultant. We speak Spanish, English, French and Portuguese. Communication is not a problem. We love learning about different cultures and sharing ours. We are so proud to live in one of the biggest and most modern cities of the world. 
We like to listen to all kinds of music, attend concerts, visit museums and landmarks, watch all type of films, go to theater plays and in general take advantage of all the diverse extensive cultural activities the city has to offer. Come and join in the fun!
As your hosts, we will share special tips to help you live as a local in one of the trendiest and best located neighborhoods in town. Don't miss it!

neiborhood_overview:
One of the trendiest, safeties and most interesting neighborhoods in town. Close to everything you may need.
Condesa is considered to be one of the most fashionable neighborhoods in Mexico City, especially among young businesspeople, artists, students and others. Its character has been compared to that of the Soho in New York and the Latin Quarter in Paris. Its avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with restaurants, cafÃ©s, boutiques and art galleries. While the area has been residential for over 100 years, its âBohemian" character has only been in existence since late 1980s. Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs. Walking distance from main museums and landmarks. An experience youâll never forget

1 Individual bed, 1 complete bathroom, 1 complete kitchenette, 1 work table, 1 drawer and 1 bookshelf.

Our charming house was built in the 50's by my beautiful grandmother. We have remodel around the house so it is nice for everyone. Our departments are great for students around the world and for normal travelers that want to know Mexico City.

-Kitchenette fully equipped with cookware, dishware, mini fridge.

-Big bookshelf and a little drawer for your clothes.

-Fresh bed linens provi

host_about:
A sensuous life!.
Travelling one of many passions.
My house is a temple,  love to share it with guests and treat them as they deserve. The energy one feels stepping inside the house is one of "nice to be home"
Guess I expect to feel the same, when I travel.  

As a guest I will respect every corner of the house I get in, as I shall expect the guests that stay at my house do the same -when staying at my place-.

Love to:
Eat, enchanting places, art, 
to read and a movie freak.

My favorite destinations are the cities that have tons to tell. Europe and Eastern Europe are my favorite destinations. Asia, blows my mind. When I travel to Asia, I would probably stay in one of the best venues. History is part of my life so as long as the destination has historical links, it will probably fit in this category. To be in contact with nature, but mostly the beach.

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia JuÃ¡rez is one of the oldest and most beautiful neighborhoods in central Mexico City. The neighborhood is shaped like a long triangle with the boundaries: Paseo de la Reforma on the north, Avenida Chapultepec on the south, and Eje 1 Poniente (Avenida Bucareli) on the east.

With palacios dating back to the Porfiriato period next to modern buildings and quiet streets lined with trees, the colonia is divided into 3 different quartes:
Korea Town (with lots of good eateries and karaoke spots)
Zona Rosa (Gay clubs, theaters and Reforma Avenue)
Barrio Gitano (the most residential area, where the spot is located)
Its pretty chill and safe. Young and old.

The space
In this house you'll you feel like home, very safe and very good atmosphere, the house is spacious, the kitchen is at your disposal, you can sit and watch TV in the living room whenever you want, the room is very spacious, quiet, bright, airy and tasteful details. It has a very large closet, the bed is very comfortable where you can rest quietly and the bathroom is always clean and tidy. A few meters from the house there are bike stations so you can go wherever you want to bike or if you prefer you can take the Metro or Metrobus are very close a few blocks away.
Nearby are shopping centers Delta Park, WTC, the Condesa, Roma, Naples there are markets, supermarkets and everything you need.
Also you ha
host_about:
I am a very outgoing person. Love to meet new people and hear boring or amazing stories (we all learn from both). I don't appreciate people who are ungrateful but some times we meet somebody like that. I Love dogs and all kind of animals, I like the cinema and the video games. I enjoy travel around the world and make friends. I love my family, I love life and I try to give the best of me every day, I allways have a smile for every body, I funny, cool and I like and enjoy to be a good host.
My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get." 
"You have to do the best with what God gave you"

name: Amazing Deal LoftBed in a Eco-Coyoacan Casita
description:
Amazing loftBed in the Succulent Mural Room.

3 bedroom sustainable house in a traditional Mexican Vecindad. Great location ... Metro, Frida Kahlo Musuem, markets

Rainwater Harvesting, Greywater Recycling, Solar Panels, Solar Waterheater, Vege Garden, Worm Composter

The room has 3-meter-high ceilings with a floating cantilevered wooden staircase that leads to a loft with a comfy full size bed. Room comes with hammock

Third floor balcony, flower terrace, rooftop for morning meditation/yoga.

The space
The bedroom is a completely remodeled room with a beautiful balcony outside the window filled with succulunts. The bedroom has a lofted bed with beautiful canderlivered floating staircase.

Guest access
The guests have access to the entire house except for the bedrooms including the rooftop, the 2 balconies, the shared patio. I have extra bikes and I can let yall borrow them any time as well!! Its a b
host_about:
Fun loving half gringo half mexican! Born in Mexico, raised in the states, and now living and loving Mexico City for 13 years. Formal Cultural Professor at Penn State University ... know all the best secrets of Mexico City.

Currently run a social business called Isla Urbana that helps low income families and communities with water scarcity issues with rainwater harvesting systems.  Check it out â¦ maybe you can volunteer for us!

Currently live with the two dogs and a cat in a 3 bedroom townhouse close to Coyoacan which I rent two beautiful loft bedrooms and at times the entire house.

Very passionate plant and sustainability lover!!

name: You can get anywhere from here!
description:
HereÂ´s an option that will make your stay easier, cozier and smarter. This flat is strategically located to make your miles go further. Nice, secure downton strip. Everything thatÂ´s worth seeing is almost within walking distance. A truly great location and a very comfortable room with a Queen Size Bed. Excellent for business trips.

The space
My guests have experienced a peaceful atmoshpere that makes them feel at home immediately. There are windows in every room so you can never feel claustrophobic and the view in most of them is quite nice.

Guest access
Except for my bedroom the whole place is at your disposal.

Other things to note
ItÂ´s a pet friendly house and we keep it fur free and fresh, so I hope you like my cats because they love humans and enjoy having guests!
host_about:
Welcome to my world.  IÂ´m a people person and have shared my place with friends from London, Germany, Finland, Japan, Spain, France and USA. 
I am very proud of MexicoÂ´s heritage and cultural background and would love to share it with you. I work as a free lance communication consultant and I also enjoy practicing and teaching meditation and some other ancestral healing traditions. My place is warm, friendly and cozy.  If you choose to stay here I could help you design or optimize your stay in MÃ©xico City and join you or drive you around if you feel like it. If you (Hidden by Airbnb) where my flat is you will see that you are within walking distance from some of the most interesting sites like Chapultepec Castle and Park, Modern Art Museum, The Anthropologic Museum, Tamayo. And you can easily and safely walk move around day or nigh since this is a very privileged area. Wether you choose to stay here or not, I hope you have an amazing time while in Mexico.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the go-to place in Mexico City. Everything is walkable, and it's full of great restaurants, bars.
It was urbanised in the 1900s as an extension of the City Centre, and still keeps lots of original buildings (have a look at the local architecture guide in the flat). It has recently undergone an extensive redevelopment to become one of the trendiest and hippest areas. It has become a focal point for art, culture, markets, bookshops, and quite a variety of bakeries, local & gourmet restaurants and bars, gourmet shops & markets, without losing its local charm. Art & crafts fairs take place every few weeks in the area and you can also do some vintage shopping and visit art galleries. Even though the neighbourhood is full of great bars and restaurants it still manages to be quiet and calm.
There are 2 supermarkets, 5 and 7 blocks away, and there are several mini-supermarkets within 100 metres distance, offering basic groceries, fruit and household items. There is als

name: Nice&Cozy... San Angel/top location
description:
Top location, enjoy a traditional Mexican small town in the city, cobblestone streets, famous for its Bazaar, museums, restaurants & cafes. In San Angel nice & cozy room with one double bed, shared bathroom. Pleasant sunny outdoor patio with a small green area, ideal for work and read. Easy access and transport.

The space
The House is very big and comfortable, has several very nice areas to chat, read, work, decoration and House is Vintage, quiet atmosphere.

La casa es muy grande y cÃ³moda, cuenta con varios espacios muy agradables para platicar, leer, trabajar, la decoraciÃ³n de la casa es Colonial Mexicano y Vintage, ambiente tranquilo.

Guest access
The outside patio have an excellent space for eat or work, the access to the kitchen is free, you just have to wash, dry and store everything you use. Bring your soap, you can wash&.dry your clothes once a week, less than 6 days have an additional cost of 100.00mxp each time you use

name: Embrace Outdoor Living at an Industrial-Inspired Escape
description:
Sink into a rattan armchair with a chilled sunset drink and take in the city's skyline from the terrace at a colorful, plant-filled oasis. Textured concrete, gleaming stainless steel, and glossy hardwood floors create a cohesive, contemporary look.

The space
One block away from The Diana Fountain and the Angel of Independence Monument. It is part of the tourist corridor known as Reforma - Historic Center.
Space is big, you can enjoy cooking and having coffee in the morning or a beer at the terrace. Tv with Netflix, cable channels, and Sony speaker so you can enjoy your own music.
Rio Lerma, it's a great street, full of restaurants and coffee shops. There are bike stations one block away. The department has excellent orientation, the sun gives during the morning and part of the afternoon in the terrace.
There is a gym just across the street "Reforma Sporting Club" with great service and a daily rate.

Other things to note
You
host_about:
Como a todos los miembros de la comunidad Airbnb, me encanta viajar, conocer nuevos lugares pero sobretodo vivir las ciudades como local. Con esa misma idea me encanta recibir gente y poder mostrarles mi ciudad y para eso es esencial hacer sentir a la gente como en su casa.
Recorrer la ciudad caminando es muy importante para conocer nuevos cafÃ©s, tiendas y restaurantes.
Para mi es esencial al recibir en mis departamentos y al viajar, encontrar un lugar limpio y organizado. Me encanta poder prepararme en la maÃ±ana un buen cafÃ© y visitar alguna panaderÃ­a cercana.

name: Double Room in PH with Jacuzzi & Rooftop near WTC
description:
Cozy room in a PH near WTC in La NÃ¡poles neighborhood, one block away from Metrobus La Piedad and 15 minutes walking from La Condesa and from Chilpancingo subway station.

Queen bed, desk, shared bathroom with closet, private roof garden access and parking spot. All services included.

The space
It's a unique PH with private roof garden surrounding it and excellent city views. You can see Torre Mayor and also WTC. We have a hot jacuzzi outside and a barbecue grill.

Guest access
Kitchen including fridge and cupboard space, living room with projector and cable TV access, dinning area for 8, laundry with drier and washer, private bathroom, private roof garden access, 100 MB WI-FI, TV with cable service (Izzi with 200 channels, Netflix and HBO) and unlimited phone calls to more than 90 countries.

Other things to note
Peaceful and respectful space.
host_about: I'm a network security consulting engineer and a yoga teacher. My partner, Naim, is a graphic designer and works for retail visual marketing. We own a two dogs that live in the property. A 4-years old girl dog named Shiva from a mixed breed that is adorable and really well behaved and a 4-year old french bull-dog named Sandor that loves playing around. Since COVID-19 quarantine started, we are both working from home most of the day during weekdays. Also, you might find me giving on-line yoga classes in the living room or terrace on mornings or evenings. Sometimes we have friends and family visiting over the weekends. We love receiving guests at home and also are Airbnb world travelers.

name: Lofty Haven in Mexico City
description:
Our space is perfect for those seeking a creative and peaceful refuge to rest and recharge. It has a comfy loft bed (double), a desk with an iPad, and a reading nook. You'll have your own bathroom just outside.
We're in a very central location and surrounded by various means of transportation; which makes it easy to visit any part of the city.

The space
Our small but bright two-bedroom apartment is on the top floor of a five story apartment building (yes, there's an elevator). The high ceilings and windows provide a spacious feel, let the light in, and also allow you to move around while on the loft bed.

Guest access
There's a balcony with a nice view, where smoking is allowed.
Kitchen access is limited to fridge and microwave use, as well as using dishes/utensils.
host_about:
I'm an engineer and a mergers and acquisitions consultant.
I enjoy riding my bicycle, reading, streaming movies and TV shows and bartending for my friends. But my favorite activity is hiking with my dog.

description:
This is a well appointed and expertly decorated condominium with breath taking views of the Revolution Monument. Its walking distance to everything on Reforma... close to both Hidalgo and Revolucion Metro Stations. Many restaurants, bars and clubs are within walking distance.

You have full access to the entire apartment with electronic code security door lock.

I am usually available via email and ALWAYS available via Whatsapp 24 hours a day.

In the middle of everything, this iconic apartment building is a new addition to the vibrant heart of the city. Walk to many nearby venues and attractions. The metro is a seven-minute walk away, which connects you to the entire city.

- Uber is a good option to get around the city.
- There is also a MetroBus stop (line 4) that runs directly to and from the airport only 1 block away that runs regularly throughout the day for $30 pesos.

host_about:

name: La Roma: Well Located, Cozy, 2BR, roof top view
description:
Our flat is in the heart of one of the most trendy areas in town. Everything is within reach for all tastes: restaurants, parks, sightseeing spots, art galleries...it's close to metro stations, bus stops and main avenues. It's an ideal place to move

The space
The flat is in a very safe building, we have 24 hour security.
It's very easy to move around: Condesa, Reforma, Polanco can be reached at walking distance, bus, taxi or evey by grabbing the underground.
The flat has 2 rooms. The main room has a walk in closet and at the end is the bathroom. The other room has its private bathroom right outside.

Guest access
Any guest would have access to the roof, which has a gorgeous view of Mexico city. It's a nice place to go read or have a drink while contemplating the stunning city.

If you are into cooking, there is a supermarket and a market 2 blocks away. Spices, oil or similar things are available to you in the kitchen.
host_about: I'm en engineer and work in a multinational company. I have lived abroad, in Italy, UK and Mexico. What these three countries have left me is my passion for food, culture, great conversation at the dinner table & a passion for travelling.

The house is located inside a private gated community, a calm oasis in the busy Mexico City. One block away from the UNAM. (Medicine, Physics veterinarian faculties and CEPE). Two blocks from the Metro Copilco Station. The Room is located in the first floor. Two tween beds, a desk and luggage benches in this very spacious room. The bathroom is across the hall, and is occasionally shared. I live in the house and it will be my pleasure to be your host.

The space
The room is sonny and ventilated. Big windows facing the private street. One very comfortable full bed. You will find extra blankets and pillows. The desk is a nice working space. A big closet and two luggage benches for you to use. Free WiFi access.

Guest access
The entire first floor of the house is open to our guests. Kitchen, dinning and living rooms are colorful and spacious. The T.V. room provides a comfortable area for you to use with a desk and appliances connec

CASITA DE AVANDARO

75sqm( 246 ft). 2 bedrooms, 2 complete showers/bathrooms, equipped kitchen and a living room that opens into a balcony. Brand new furniture, comfortable beds and quality bed linen. Access to roof terrace. Security 24/7. Elevator. Free parking inside the building.

The space
We are located two blocks away from the mall Parque Delta (where you will find groceries, shops, restaurants, etc) and just a few meters away from one of the most important highways in the City (Viaducto Miguel aleman) which will allow you to move to other parts of the city (north,south, east, west) with ease.

Within 10-15 minutes by car or taxi you can reach: Condesa, Roma, Del Valle (less than 3 usd/euros by Uber or Yaxi)

neiborhood_overview:
The neighborhood:
Colonia Roma Norte, or âLa Roma,â as we locals call it, is one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city and has some of the best examples of art nouveau, art deco, eclectic and French architecture in the country. Take a stroll or bike around the neighborhood and youâll find everything from old-school bookstores and ice cream parlors to trendy clothing boutiques and amazing cafÃ©s and art galleries. There are great restaurants for every taste and budget where you can try the most traditional Mexican dishes as well as the tastiest international cuisine.

As for the nightlife, this might be the most exciting place in Mexico City, with fantastic cocktail and wine bars and even some speakeasies. Artists and bohemians from all over Mexico and abroad love La Roma. We promise you will too!

host_about:
I am a good person. I am 48 years old. I am quiet, homey, educated, responsable, I am concerned to do the right things so everyone is happy. I was born in the year 68. Sign: Leo.  I am artist, dance flamenco for 23 years, though I am dedicated to the logoterapy-psicoterapy, I love swimming and I practice it regularly. I like to spend time with my family.

* Traveling: trips that I've liked most had been "road trips". Travel a couple of hours on the road, find the historical centres of cities or walking arround small towns, enjoy the local gastronomy, landscapes, views, and make another trip to visit or spend the night in another town. Visit national parks, beaches and countryside. Also, I like visit museums, go to the tourist attractions and have chance to go to the theatre, ballet or that goes on. I also love cruises and ski holidays.

* Countries: my favorite country is Spain, the style of life, its gastronomy, its regions and natural beauties, its contrasts and itss people 
I love Europe. I studied in England and Scotland when I was 17/18 years old, so  I'm an Anglophile's too. 
I also love Portugal, France, Italy, Switzerland, Croatia, Germany and the Scandinavian countries 
I love to visit someday the Greek Islands. Turkey, Poland, and other regions of France and Italy that I've still been missing  as Brittany, Normandy, La Provence, La cÃ³te du Rhone, or la Calabria, Sicily and Sardinia...  
Iâve also got fascinated by the French Polynesia. 
New Zealand, Australia and Japan are of my favorite countries in other continets,as well as  Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia.   
I like the United States, specially New York, San Francisco, Boston and Miami. I also loved Canada, but I still missing the West Coast.
In Latin America I like, especially, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Costa Rica and I would like to visit Colombia.  

* In the gourmet aspect, I love I love Spanish gastronomy. Also French cuisine, Japanese, Italian and the Mexican. 
* I couldnât not live without flamenco, without my beloved ones, without swimming lessons, without travelling and enjoy good food and the pleasures of life. 
* Books. The ones I like most are the biographical of great men and wome in history, for example: "Winston Churchill", "HernÃ¡n Cortez", Felipe II, Francisco I, "Maximiliano and Carlota", "Porfirio DÃ­az", "Enrique VIII and his six wives". "Elizabeht I, Mary Queen of Scots". on the other hand: "The Dorian Gray Portrait", "Another twist", "Crime and punishment", "The dog in the manger", "la Celestina", "flowers in the attic,"the night is Virgin","friends that I lost, "was yesterday and I don't remember", "existential psychotherapy"and "The gift of therapy" of Yalom, among others.  * Films. 
* Favorite films. "Dangerous Liassons", "Devil were's Prada", "Te doy mis ojos", "La Comunidad", "American Beauty" "Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios", "Somewhere in Time", Anne of the Thousand days", "The Others", "The Sound of Music", "The Shining", "Shindrel List" "Fried Green Tomatoes", "Coma", "El hada ignorante", "The Queen", "El hijo de la novia", "Elsa y Fred", "Camila, "The Black Swan", "Nosotros los Nobles", "Como agua para Chocolate" "The Graduate", "Little Miss Sunshine". "Transamerica"....
*Tv shows. "Downton Abby", "Breaking Bad", "Miss Marple",  "Gran Hotel", "Club de Cuervos, "The Forsyte Saga", The Nanny"...
* My favorite dishes: Iberian ham, baby squid in its ink, abanda rice, Wellington fillet, eels, fabada, salami, fondue, spaghetti Carbonara", Vienershnitzel, good burgers, sandwiches or gourmet snacks, and Mexican tacos. Desserts: custard, homemade flan napolitano, Santiago cake, Nantes, Missippi Mug foot, the apfell strudel, profiteroles, crepes Suzette, cherries jubilee, arroz con leche, Catalan creme, the marzipan and nougat.
* As guest I consider myself to be very  clean, tidy, formal, responsable, not noisy. I do like confort and cleaness, a peaceful and not noisy enviroment, kindness and gentleness, a good firm bed, a nice pillow, black out, TV system and WiFi, and sometimes central heating, a fan or A/C if  necessary.
* As host I like to please my guests as much as posible. I like to do my best so they could feel very confortable and satisfied. Iâd like to know their purpose of their stay and the type of holidays, interests or kind of food they like, if they are vegeterian or not, If they come for pleasure or for work,  if they need some special requirments in other to find out locations or sites they might find important for their stay.

* Quotes that I like: 
"Blessed are those who know how to give without remembering it and receive without forgetting it".
 "Blessed are the men of good will".
 "Never despair still in direst distress, because of dark clouds fall fertilizing and clean water." 
"The limits of my language are the limits of my world."  
âA master is made by practice".
 "Bizarre is our condition here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit without knowing why, yet sometimes we believe guess a purpose". Albert Einstein 
"The largest democracies weakness is economic fear." Albert Einstein
 "if what you say is not more beautiful than silence, not tell". Arab proverb. 
 "All the passions are good while one owns them and all of them are bad when enslave us." 
"If all the bad people were black and all the good white, from what color would you be?... because I would have striped skin."

Despite the strong transformations it had faced it still retains many houses and buildings of its best time with âPorfirian architecture, wich represents a great legacy now days for Mexico City and this have made the district return and emerge as an atractive, centric, and trendy neibourhood.
La colonia Roma and colonia HipÃ³dromo-Condesa is a very demanded area and greatly appreciated for their centricity, its wooded spaces in streets, parks and avenues with an alternative atmosphere wich placed them as our "Village". neiborhood_overview:
TIENDAS / SUPERMARKET:
There are lots of small "tiendas" (almost at every corner) where you can get most of the "daily" needs. A big supermarket (SORIANA) open 24/7, is just 10 walk away.

PHARMACIES:
serveral pharmacies around (5-10 min).

MERCADOS:
Every Tuesday there is a typical TIANQUIS (small mercado) just 2 blocks away, where you can get fruit and veggies, food and lots of other stuff.
The MERCADO DE LA ESCANDON is just 5 min away. It opens every day. Good for food (small restaurants, comida corrida) or fruit, veggies.

RESTAURANTS/TACOS:
there are several small restaurants or taco-places around. Also at night.

NIGHTLIFE:
in CONDESA (very close) you can find all kind of bars or restaurants you like.

neiborhood_overview: Large community, comfortable, friendly neighbors. This is an authentic Mexican neighborhood and you will get to experience it first hand. You can easily walk to two markets: Dalia Market (7 minutes) and San Cosme Market (10 minutes) to do grocery shopping like the locals. Forum Buenavista, a pretty big shopping centre that features major retailers, cinemas, restaurants,  theaters, and a gym its close by (1km). Ecobici is found within 12 minutes of the premises for your convenience. Around the neighborhood, you will find bakeries, tortillerias, butcher's shops, and many other places to experience authentic Mexican traditions and cuisine.

The apartment is located in Condesa, which is the vibrant and modern part of the city. Just a foot step away, there are many trendy restaurants. You will find everything from a traditional taqueria (typical Mexican tacos) to a high end modern fusion cuisne.

name: 10min walk to Frida Kahlo Museum, Coyoacan & metro
description:
Elegant bedroom with spacious private bathroom in family house within historic neighbourhood of CoyoacÃ¡n center. 10 minutes walk from Frida Kahlo - "Casa Azul" and Trotsky museums, 5 mins walk from metro General Anaya station.
Comfortable queen-size mattress, Wi-Fi, TV, refrigerator, hairdryer, ironing board, black-out curtains included.

The space
Our guest-room is an original spacious master bedroom, tastefully decorated with its own large en-suite bathroom including marble double sink, and rain shower with wifi internet access within a fully renovated courtyard home. The bedroom remains cool, even during hot weather. Beautiful historic features include 3.5 meter beamed ceilings, soaring arches, steel framed windows and art deco panelled doors. Small children and babies are also very welcome at no extra charge and we have a travel cot if needed.

Guest access
The ground floor entry to the master suite provides easy access to a lovely

name: Outstanding,  spacious, 3-bedroom gem in Condesa
description:
In the heart of Condesa, on a quiet street, the apartment features the most contemporary tasteful interior in the area, in addition to a highly secure and monitored environment.

It is close to everything you need: restaurants, shops, bars, food stores, parks with a children's playground.

When you book, I send my Welcome Guide with practical advice and tips about the apartment and the city. Past guests have found it very helpful to plan their trip.

The space
--Ground floor
--3 bedrooms, 2 with queen beds, one with 2 twin beds
--2 of the bedrooms have tables for work
--high speed WiFi, 200 mbps
--2 bathrooms / with toiletries
--living room, dining area and kitchen are all integrated
--beautiful hammered marble floors
--WiFi, English/Spanish TV, speaker plug-in for cellphone
-- fully equipped kitchen, with dishwasher
--dining area with glass skylight, also perfect for home office
--windows op
host_about: Am totally bilingual, work as a translator and simultaneous conference interpreter. For years was fully involved in the arts: painting, acting. Then became a journalist covering Mexico for foreign publications, such as TIME magazine, the San Francisco Chronicle, also did radio for WGBH in Boston  Love dogs, taking long walks, good food.

neiborhood_overview:
Eclectic, nostalgic, and beautiful, Condesa is one of the special treasures of Mexico City., recently voted the #1 city in the world to visit. Strolling under giant trees, centered on landscaped boulevards, access to bakeries, top-level open air restaurants, bars, shops, specialty food and liquor stores, are within easy walking distance.

Condesa is a mixture of Art Deco, Spanish and modern architecture creating an adventure around every turn, a place that offers a more gentle time along with the vibrancy of contemporary life. With two beautiful parks and endless variety, you'll fall in love with a local flavor that's old and new, totally intertwined.

host_about:
Somos un equipo de gente experimentada que nacimos, crecimos y hemos trabajado en la Ciudad de MÃ©xico. Â¡Conocemos bien nuestro entorno y nuestra pasiÃ³n es encontrar soluciones y optimizar posibilidades para cada uno de nuestros clientes!

Nuestros clientes, mexicanos de todas partes al igual que del extranjero, son en gran medida recurrentes y nos han visto crecer y evolucionar a lo largo del tiempo lo cual ha ido retroalimentando nuestras habilidades y pasiÃ³n por servir, y son una evidencia de nuestra ventaja competitiva al ser capaces de ir adaptando nuestra visiÃ³n a los tiempos cambiantes de nuestro entorno tanto  como ciudadanos en esta rica y compleja urbe y naciÃ³n, y como ciudadanos del mundo en una constante transformaciÃ³n.

neiborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

The space
The heart of CoyoacÃ¡n is a special village in itself. The area consists of three colonies: the Colonia Condesa, the Colonia HipÃ³dromo and the Colonia HipÃ³dromo Condesa, and is well known for its large number of cafes, bookstores, restaurants, galleries, and boutiques, as well as its cultural and nightlife. The Colonia Condesa shares her border and bohemian spirit with Colonia Roma, and together they form the so-called Cultural Corridor Roma Condesa.

host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home.  Leo and I will be glad to share our place with you during your visit to Mexico City, and make you feel at home. We really like meeting people from all cardinal points. We have travelled to different countries and this is why we understand what you need. Leo is a dentist and I am a business consultant. We speak Spanish, English, French and Portuguese. Communication is not a problem. We love learning about different cultures and sharing ours. We are so proud to live in one of the biggest and most modern cities of the world. 
We like to listen to all kinds of music, attend concerts, visit museums and landmarks, watch all type of films, go to theater plays and in general take advantage of all the diverse extensive cultural activities the city has to offer. Come and join in the fun!
As your hosts, we will share special tips to help you live as a local in one of the trendiest and best located neighborhoods in town. Don't miss it!

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa. El mejor lugar para estar y conocer la Ciudad de MÃ©xico. Excelentemente bien ubicada y comunicada, te ofrece una gran variedad de opciones turÃ­sticas, restaurantes, bares, y centros culturales. Cerca de los mejores museos de la ciudad.
Condesa is considered to be one of the most fashionable neighborhoods in Mexico City, especially among young businesspeople, artists, students and others. Its character has been compared to that of the Soho in New York and the Latin Quarter in Paris. Its avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with restaurants, cafÃ©s, boutiques and art galleries. While the area has been residential for over 100 years, its âBohemian" character has only been in existence since late 1980s. Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs.

neiborhood_overview: Colonia Juarez, a neighborhood nestled in the pulsing heart of Mexico City, beckons the wanderer with its aged architecture and verdant avenues. Art and history mingle here, in the galleries and museums that line the streets, such as the Museum of the City of Mexico, a testament to the rich tradition of this metropolis. Amidst the hustle and bustle, one can find refuge in the tranquil parks, the Alameda Central being a favorite among locals and travelers alike. The neighborhood is also a haven for the discerning shopper, offering an array of boutiques and markets selling traditional Mexican crafts and trinkets. And the culinary explorer will not be disappointed with the abundance of delectable restaurants and street vendors. Colonia Juarez, a tapestry of culture, beauty, and vitality.
neighborhood_overview: Colonia Juarez, a neighborhood nestled in the pulsing heart of Mexico City, beckons the wanderer with its aged architecture and verdant avenues. Art and history mingle here, in the galleries and museums that line the streets, such as the Museum of the City of Mexico, a testament to the rich tradition of this metropolis. Amidst the hustle and bustle, one can find refuge in the tranquil parks, the Alameda Central being a favorite among locals and travelers alike. The neighborhood is also a haven for the discerning shopper, offering an array of boutiques and markets selling traditional Mexican crafts and trinkets. And the culinary explorer will not be disappointed with the abundance of delectable restaurants and street vendors. Colonia Juarez, a tapestry of culture, beauty, and vitality.

And the culinary explorer will not be disappointed with the abundance of delectable restaurants and street vendors. Colonia Juarez, a tapestry of culture, beauty, and vitality.

name: Kick Back and Relax at an Industrial, New York-Inspired Loft
description:
Choose from an Acapulco chair or a teal Eames model for a coffee at this quirky urban oasis with pop art influences and mismatched furniture. Polished parquet floors contrast with an open metal staircase and exposed concrete for an eclectic look.
Private parking and 24 hours security.

We have an agreement with a laundry company that goes for your clothes and bring them back to your door for only 18 pesos kilo.

Loft Industrial style Apartment, completely equipped and furnished 1.0 km from Santa Fe.

Why to stay in this Loft?
Because we put you absolutely everything !!. You just bring your clothes and go!
Our fully equipped loft can be rent for days, a week, a month, three months, a year, or as long as you can think of.

Payment includes daily cleaning (except Sundays), electricity, water and gas. We also put crockery and kitchen utensils, microwave oven, refrigerator, blender, toaster, coffee maker, can opener, juicer, etc.

neiborhood_overview:
Del Valle is a very charming area. It is next to Condesa and Roma neighborhoods, so its a chic and social zone, with good restaurants, but continues the feeling traditional old Mexico, with families and pets walking around. The area is full of options for all people, you can walk or use the public transport.
Next to must sight sites in Mexico City like Historic Center (Colonial and Prehispanic area), Condesa borough (historic houses), Roma borough (nice restaurants), Coyoacan (Frida Khalo museum), Reforma (financial district), Parks Alameda and Chapultepec (real castle in the central park of city) and San Angel (exconvent).
Del Valle is one of the last neighborhoods on the core of the city that still has a lot of old and original houses, the old houses of the neighborhoods around were replaced by modern buildings.

name: Bright, Modern, Cozy Apartment & Great Location
description:
This beautiful, spacious and full of life apartment is located in Roma Norte neighborhood, just at the limit with Condesa neighborhood together they form the so-called Roma Condesa Cultural Corridor. The principal characteristic of these neighborhoods is its cosmopolitan air, represented by its gastronomy, a large number of cafes, bookstores, restaurants, galleries, and boutiques, as well as for its cultural and nightlife.

The space
Inside the apartment, space is large and full of life. It is very well distributed in ninety square meters. Every room receives great natural light, in total there are five independent areas: Dinning-Living room, Kitchen, Bathroom, Studio room, and Bedroom. Floors are made of Wood and Marmol. The bed is a queen size (great mattress) and the shower has a tub (hydromassage). A new washing machine has been recently installed in a little closet inside the apartment.

Guest access
All areas inside the apartment are fo
host_about:
I am an architect, currently focused on teaching and design. Born in Mexico City, where I live and develop my project on Architecture education. I realize my masters in London and Barcelona, and my PhD in Valencia. I love to meet new cultures!  
Things I enjoy most are: being with my students, visiting museums, walking around the city, make new friends, learn new things, meet architecture, watching dance, eat at a terrace, a good conversation.
As a guest and host, it would be like on any day of my life, respectful, cheerful, neat and clean.

name: CASA DELFINO 5 BED 3SH BATH
description:
Beautiful house in the Condesa, built in 1937. Recently restored and redecorated.
It has five bedrooms, three bathrooms and all services. Fully functional. Located in a very quiet street, but conveniently close to all kinds of restaurants, bars, cafes and beautiful parks, among many other attractions. Great for families or groups of friends up to 10 guests.

The space
The house has 5 bedrooms, 4 of them with king size beds and the remaining one with a queen size bed. All rooms have closets and safety box.
Four rooms have a work table.
In the common area we have a desk with multiple drawers, to work comfortably.
A full bathroom with toilet, sink and shower on the ground floor and 2 full bathrooms also upstairs.
Full kitchen including gas oven and laundry center.

Guest access
The house is absolutely private for the guests. You can access the backyard and enjoy the garden table.

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the most beautiful and historic neighborhoods in Mexico City. Here you will find beautiful parks, streets and buildings more than 100 years old.

neiborhood_overview:
Artsy, bohemian neighborhood located 20 minutes away from the Centro Historico (Historic Downtown) and next to Condesa neighborhood.

Roma offers a pleasant change of peace from Mexico Cityâs busy downtown. Spend the day wandering around the neighborhoods, taking in the tranquil atmosphere and admiring the beautifully restored Art Deco architecture, wide parks and welcoming plazas.

This area is also great for browsing the local art galleries, shops and markets.

Roma is also known for having some of Mexico Cityâs best dining and nightlife.

Artsy, bohemian neighborhood located 20 minutes away from the Centro Historico (Historic Downtown) and next to Condesa neighborhood.

Roma offers a pleasant change of peace from Mexico Cityâs busy downtown. Spend the day wandering around the neighborhoods, taking in the tranquil atmosphere and admiring the beautifully restored Art Deco architecture, wide parks and welcoming plazas.

This area is also great for browsing the local art galleries, shops and markets.

Roma is also known for having some of Mexico Cityâs best dining and nightlife.

name: Confortable House in Del Valle Centro
description:
Central and well located room in Col. Del Valle a few blocks from Metrobus, Metro L3, bicycle stations a few meters, near to Condesa. 1 bedroom, queen bed, desk, closet, cable TV, wifi, washer, dryer, shared bathroom, kitchen, living room, balcony.

The space
In this house you'll you feel like home, very safe and very good atmosphere, the house is spacious, the kitchen is at your disposal, you can sit and watch TV in the living room whenever you want, the room is very spacious, quiet, bright, airy and tasteful details. It has a very large closet, the bed is very comfortable where you can rest quietly and the bathroom is always clean and tidy. A few meters from the house there are bike stations so you can go wherever you want to bike or if you prefer you can take the Metro or Metrobus are very close a few blocks away.
Nearby are shopping centers Delta Park, WTC, the Condesa, Roma, Napoles there are markets, supermarkets and everything you need.

host_about:
I am a very outgoing person. Love to meet new people and hear boring or amazing stories (we all learn from both). I don't appreciate people who are ungrateful but some times we meet somebody like that. I Love dogs and all kind of animals, I like the cinema and the video games. I enjoy travel around the world and make friends. I love my family, I love life and I try to give the best of me every day, I allways have a smile for every body, I funny, cool and I like and enjoy to be a good host.
My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get." 
"You have to do the best with what God gave you"

host_about:
My family and I love the heart of Coyoacan which is a âvillageâ of its own in Mexico City.  As travelers, we have visited and also have lived abroad. We welcome you onboard and wish to make your stay wonderful!!!

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia RomaÂ is one of the coolest neighborhoods in Mexico City.Â Â 

Best transportation options inÂ Colonia Roma?Â 
While public Metrobuses run down the main roads that border Roma, your best bet for within the neighborhood is walking or biking. Walking down the wide, colorful avenues gives you the time and space to enjoy the architecture, discover hidden boutiques, and take in the energy from this incredible neighborhood.Â 
For more efficient transportation, utilize the bike lanes along Avenida de los Insurgentes. For bicycle rental options, there are numerous EcoBici stations scattered throughout Roma. In order to use EcoBici, you must have a card, so they arenât ideal for tourists with a limited travel window. Weekend or week-long travelers would have better luck with private bike rentals likeÂ Casai Bikes, available to rent in select Roma Norte units.

Markets are a dependable feature of all neighborhoods in Mexico City. Roma is home to some of the best!Â Â

You will have a nice terrace to relax, have breakfast dine in or chill out. Kitchenette equipped with microwave, sink and dinnerware. Just a few steps we have two supermarkets, a regular one and an organic one.
Around we have nice cafes, restaurants, shops and also you will find a lot of organic places to shop or eat.
YOU WILL LOVE IT.

The space
The house was built in the 30's, has a bit of influence of the Art Deco. It is located in a very quiet spot of the house so you will be able to hear birds in the morning and crickets at night.
Near supermarkets, parks, shops and restaurants.

Guest access

Kitchen area with microwave and sink, fully equipped.

description:
Casa Moctezuma is an architectonic jewel, a space where the original architecture of the house -built in the early XX century- and a contemporary design come together harmoniously, creating a unique space in the heart of the historic and very save neighborhood of CoyoacÃ¡n. Each of our rooms constitute a particular universe habited by objects and fine details chose with affection and good taste.

The space
The rooms we offered are duplex lofts with two doble beds. All of them are equipped with a private bathroom, a small living and dining room, wi-fi, a small refrigerator and kitchen, a tableware set, and portable heating. Some of them has a microwave.

A few blocks from the house you have: La Casa Azul where the extraordinary painter Frida Kahlo was born and died, the CoyoacÃ¡n Vivarium, the National Film Institut âthe best place to watch the most contemporary creations of young talented directors from Mexico and worldwide-. description:
Make Mexico City your new home, while doing your best work. This beautifully decorated apartment, featuring a comfortable working space, has everything you need to be inspired and productive while exploring one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in the city.

Take a break and walk to Amsterdam Avenue or grab coffee at Parque Mexico, both just around the corner.

The building has 24/7 security, an impressive roof with a fully-equipped gym and a 360 view of the beautiful Mexico City.

The space
Apartment's layout and decor gives it a homey atmosphere perfect for working during the day, and enjoying it in the afternoons. Spacious, fully-equipped kitchen with all essentials, dishwasher and more. Separate room for laundry with washer/dryer. The TV room is a great nook for relaxing and whining down. neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is an area of Mexico City that, together with Colonia Roma, it is designated as a "Barrio MÃ¡gico TurÃ­stico" ("Magic Neighborhood for Tourists"). Together they are often referred to as CondesaâRoma, one of the most architecturally significant and bastion of the creative communities of the city.

The area is considered to be fashionable and popular with younger businesspeople, students and pet lovers. It features a large number of international restaurants, bars and nightclubs.

"Condesa" means "countess" and it is named after MarÃ­a Magdalena DÃ¡valos de Bracamontes y Orozco, the Countess of Miravalle, whose lands stretched from what is now Colonia Roma to Tacubaya.

name: Beautiful apartment in the best Polanco location!
description:
Stylish and bright Polanco apartment in the middle of "Polanquito", half a block away from Lincoln park!
This apartment has it all: Location, comfort and style. Also, it's huge! And Polanco's vibrant life starts right at your door steps: restaurants, bars, supermarket and great shopping. And at the same time you enjoy a nice view on lovely trees and the local scene.

The apartment is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids) and groups.

The space
This apartment is a modern, large space (220 m2!) with lots of sunlight with 3 spacious bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a large kitchen and a huge dining and living area. The apartment is located in a 5 story building (2nd floor) in the middle of Polanco, right next to Lincoln park for minimum 2-night stays.

All bedrooms have very comfortable beds (king and queen) and blackout shades or curtains. The walls of the three bedrooms have been freshly painted.
host_about:
I am from Germany and divide my time between San Francisco and Mexico City. 

I am a cofounder of a technology startup. I have been offering my Mexico apartment now for a few years and I am excited that I just recently added a new Airbnb exclusive apartment in the same building, I hope you love it as much as I do! 

As a host, I love to meet new people from all over the world and make them feel comfortable during their stay. I am a big fan of Mexico and love traveling, good food, yoga and everything that is good for the soul :)

neiborhood_overview:
Polanco (and specifically "Polanquito") is one of the best and safest neighborhoods in Mexico-City with lots of foreigners living in the area. Around the corner is the nice Lincoln park, which is great for morning runs, afternoon strolls and people-watching. Ideal for business visitors and tourists!

Right outside the door you have access to plenty of international and local restaurants, coffee shops, great fresh juice spots, a supermarket, shops, pharmacy, dry cleaning etc. Presidente Mazaryk Av (the glamorous shopping street) is just a block away from the apartment.

name: Centric studio with shared terrace in la NÃ¡poles
description:
Comfy little studio near the WTC and Condesa at the rooftop of the building. Ideal for one person, a couple or two friends who wish to take the best out of Mexico City.

The space
The studio is located at the rooftop of the building and has a nice terrace to hang out and relax. The ambiance and the view are swell.

The studio has a full-sized bed, a kitchen, a personal bathroom, a breakfast bar furniture, a TV and multiple services included.

The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs. The stairs are pretty light (in my opinion), as the apartment is located in the 5th floor.

The location is great! Really centric and close to public transportation. It is two blocks away from the World Trade Center and the Condesa neighborhood is just 3km away.

The neighborhood is well known and contemporar
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

host_about:

name: Comfort with a gorgeous view on Avenida Amsterdam
description:
Lovely 9th floor apt with floor to ceiling windows. Situated between Roma Norte and Condesa, you'll be a short walking distance from many of the city's best bars, restaurants, night clubs, and art galleries. You'll also be close to Chapultepec, Paseo la Reforma, Parque Mexico, and a short Uber ride from the Centro HistÃ³rico. Whether looking for an adventure or a quiet stay, aquÃ­ tienes tu casa.

Important to note: I still live here! You'll find clothes in the closet and some personal items.

The space
In addition to the apartment the unit has access to a 19th floor roof garden with an even more expansive south-facing view of the city. Lawn chairs and umbrellas are up there for relaxing.

Guest access
Sorry, no guests, just you and your partner if you're traveling with one.
host_about:
Gringo from San Diego working at a fintech company here in Mexico City. Work and social travel keep me moving around a fair bit. I love connecting with people where they live and work and am super low maintenance. As a host it's a joy being the guy to put a roof over your head and I hope you love the place and the neighborhood as much as I do.

Airbnb suggests a life motto. Here's one: Don't be afraid to start. Just making a beginning is often the hardest part.

name: Apartment very Centric and Cozy
description:
The apartment is located south of the Historic Center, very close to the Zocalo, the Cathedral, Bellas Artes and many other historical attractions. The metro station is 5 minutes away by foot and it takes you directly to the most touristic places.

There is a shopping center "Portal Centro", 10 minutes away by foot (Wal-Mart, Sams) and 15 minutes away by car are the Foro Sol and the Palacio de los Deportes.
If you need parking, let me know when booking :)

The space
- The apartment has 2 bedrooms: a double bed and a Queen Size bed.
- 1 full bathroom.
- For your comfort, the apartment has an equipped kitchen and a small dining room.
- The living room has a TV with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney + and YouTube.
- There is parking space inside the building in the basement.
- There is a balcony where smoking is allowed.

4 PEOPLE ARE ALLOWED AT MAXIMUM.

Guest access

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia TrÃ¡nsito is located in the south of the historic center of the city. The apartment is near to the most tourist areas in the city downtown, such as, Zocalo, Palace of Bellas Artes, Reforma, Colonia Roma, and the Monument to the Revolution, which are some of the most famous places in Mexico City.

There is a metro station just 5 minutes away by foot, which will take you to the most famous area. You can even get to places without taking public transport.

In the neighborhood, there are many small and cheap restaurants with the most typical food in the city or you have plenty of options using Uber Eats or Rappi.

It is a 10-minute walk to a newly opened shopping center that has a Wal-Mart and a Sams. There is also a food court area, several outlet stores, and even a cinema.

It is a great area to stay at if you are visiting this big city and if you want to visit different places and take advantage of the time.

name: CHARMING  PRIVATE GARDEN ROOM
description:
You will love my space for its location, the privacy of the room, which is independent from the main house, and its cozy garden to sit and enjoy the green area.
Condesa is known for its cafes, bookstores, restaurants, as well as for its cultural and night life. Condesa shares its border and bohemian spirit with Colonia Roma.
Ideal location to visit Chapultepec, the Museum of Anthropology, the entire Reforma Ave. area of Museums, the Zona Rosa and the downtown area.
CHECK-IN FROM 3pm to 11pm

The space
A comfortable garden room with a queen size bed, bedside tables, lamps and a single sofa. The room also has an en suite bathroom for the exclusive use of guests. The room opens to a lovely garden in one of the nicest suburbs in Mexico City.
Due to the COVID pandemic the thorough cleaning and sanitization of the room is guaranteed for every stay.
CHECK-IN FROM 3pm to 11pm.

neiborhood_overview: The neighborhood is unique because it is strategically situated near every point of interest, but away from traffic, caos and smog.  It is a very Green Neighborhood, upscale and full of vegetation and trees.   Most of the worlds embassies are located here.  The neighborhood dates back to the 1920s, when it was founded with the name Chapultepec Heights.  The neighborhood is located in the center of other importants parts of the city therefore you can get anywhere quickly.  The areas that you can get to quickly by walking, biking or Uber are: Polanco (10 min Bike/ 5 min Uber), Condesa (15 min Uber), Roma (15 min Uber) , Santa Fe (15 min Uber), Tecamachalco (10 min Bike) , Centro Historico (15 min Uber), Interlomas (20 min Uber).

host_about:
I am a good person. I am 48 years old. I am quiet, homey, educated, responsable, I am concerned to do the right things so everyone is happy. I was born in the year 68. Sign: Leo.  I am artist, dance flamenco for 23 years, though I am dedicated to the logoterapy-psicoterapy, I love swimming and I practice it regularly. I like to spend time with my family.

* Traveling: trips that I've liked most had been "road trips". Travel a couple of hours on the road, find the historical centres of cities or walking arround small towns, enjoy the local gastronomy, landscapes, views, and make another trip to visit or spend the night in another town. Visit national parks, beaches and countryside. Also, I like visit museums, go to the tourist attractions and have chance to go to the theatre, ballet or that goes on. I also love cruises and ski holidays.

* Countries: my favorite country is Spain, the style of life, its gastronomy, its regions and natural beauties, its contrasts and itss people 
I love Europe. I studied in England and Scotland when I was 17/18 years old, so  I'm an Anglophile's too. 
I also love Portugal, France, Italy, Switzerland, Croatia, Germany and the Scandinavian countries 
I love to visit someday the Greek Islands. Turkey, Poland, and other regions of France and Italy that I've still been missing  as Brittany, Normandy, La Provence, La cÃ³te du Rhone, or la Calabria, Sicily and Sardinia...  
Iâve also got fascinated by the French Polynesia. 
New Zealand, Australia and Japan are of my favorite countries in other continets,as well as  Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia.   
I like the United States, specially New York, San Francisco, Boston and Miami. I also loved Canada, but I still missing the West Coast.
In Latin America I like, especially, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Costa Rica and I would like to visit Colombia.  

* In the gourmet aspect, I love I love Spanish gastronomy. Also French cuisine, Japanese, Italian and the Mexican. 
* I couldnât not live without flamenco, without my beloved ones, without swimming lessons, without travelling and enjoy good food and the pleasures of life. 
* Books. The ones I like most are the biographical of great men and wome in history, for example: "Winston Churchill", "HernÃ¡n Cortez", Felipe II, Francisco I, "Maximiliano and Carlota", "Porfirio DÃ­az", "Enrique VIII and his six wives". "Elizabeht I, Mary Queen of Scots". on the other hand: "The Dorian Gray Portrait", "Another twist", "Crime and punishment", "The dog in the manger", "la Celestina", "flowers in the attic,"the night is Virgin","friends that I lost, "was yesterday and I don't remember", "existential psychotherapy"and "The gift of therapy" of Yalom, among others.  * Films. 
* Favorite films. "Dangerous Liassons", "Devil were's Prada", "Te doy mis ojos", "La Comunidad", "American Beauty" "Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios", "Somewhere in Time", Anne of the Thousand days", "The Others", "The Sound of Music", "The Shining", "Shindrel List" "Fried Green Tomatoes", "Coma", "El hada ignorante", "The Queen", "El hijo de la novia", "Elsa y Fred", "Camila, "The Black Swan", "Nosotros los Nobles", "Como agua para Chocolate" "The Graduate", "Little Miss Sunshine". "Transamerica"....
*Tv shows. "Downton Abby", "Breaking Bad", "Miss Marple",  "Gran Hotel", "Club de Cuervos, "The Forsyte Saga", The Nanny"...
* My favorite dishes: Iberian ham, baby squid in its ink, abanda rice, Wellington fillet, eels, fabada, salami, fondue, spaghetti Carbonara", Vienershnitzel, good burgers, sandwiches or gourmet snacks, and Mexican tacos. Desserts: custard, homemade flan napolitano, Santiago cake, Nantes, Missippi Mug foot, the apfell strudel, profiteroles, crepes Suzette, cherries jubilee, arroz con leche, Catalan creme, the marzipan and nougat.
* As guest I consider myself to be very  clean, tidy, formal, responsable, not noisy. I do like confort and cleaness, a peaceful and not noisy enviroment, kindness and gentleness, a good firm bed, a nice pillow, black out, TV system and WiFi, and sometimes central heating, a fan or A/C if  necessary.
* As host I like to please my guests as much as posible. I like to do my best so they could feel very confortable and satisfied. Iâd like to know their purpose of their stay and the type of holidays, interests or kind of food they like, if they are vegeterian or not, If they come for pleasure or for work,  if they need some special requirments in other to find out locations or sites they might find important for their stay.

* Quotes that I like: 
"Blessed are those who know how to give without remembering it and receive without forgetting it".
 "Blessed are the men of good will".
 "Never despair still in direst distress, because of dark clouds fall fertilizing and clean water." 
"The limits of my language are the limits of my world."  
âA master is made by practice".
 "Bizarre is our condition here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit without knowing why, yet sometimes we believe guess a purpose". Albert Einstein 
"The largest democracies weakness is economic fear." Albert Einstein
 "if what you say is not more beautiful than silence, not tell". Arab proverb. 
 "All the passions are good while one owns them and all of them are bad when enslave us." 
"If all the bad people were black and all the good white, from what color would you be?... because I would have striped skin."

neiborhood_overview: CoyoacÃ¡n  refers to one of the 16 boroughs (delegaciones) of the Federal District of Mexico City as well as the former village which is now the boroughâs âhistoric center.â The name comes from Nahuatl and most likely means âplace of coyotes,â when the Aztecs named a pre-Hispanic village on the southern shore of Lake Texcoco which was dominated by the Tepanec people. Against Aztec domination, these people welcomed HernÃ¡n CortÃ©s and the Spanish, who used the area as a headquarters during the Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire and made it the first capital of New Spain between 1521 and 1523. The village, later municipality, of Coyoacan remained completely independent of Mexico City through the colonial period into the 19th century. In 1857, the area was incorporated into the Federal District when this district was expanded. In 1928, the borough was created when the Federal District was divided into sixteen boroughs. name: Lovely, bright and quiet apartment in La Condesa
description:
Lovely, luminous and fully refurbished apartment in a quiet street of La Condesa. Only five minutes walk from the street Michoacan that is renowned for its restaurants and attractions.

The apartment has a large bedroom with a terrace that fills with sunshine in the afternoon. The large living room has a couch and a smart TV. A perfect space to relax and hang out. The kitchenette is equipped with a refrigerator, a stove and a large dining table. The bathroom has a shower and a dressing room.

The space
The apartment is fully independent and with a private entry, but it is attached to my house. This allows me to be close to my guests if something comes up.

Please bear in mind that the apartment is on a second floor and there is no elevator.

Guest access
You will have private access to a fully equipped kitchenette, wifi internet and cable TV.

If you are staying for more than one week, we provide you with a clea
host_about:
I am a contented 70's year old physician who worked at UNAM - the main University in Mexico - for many years.

I am now retired, my children are grown-ups and I own a lovely house in Colonia Condesa.

I have multiple interests and activities that fill my schedule since my retirement. I work as a therapist, I study Eastern philosophies, I love to go to the movies and to concerts, to travel and to spoil my grandson.

I am looking forward to meet all interesting people who want to enjoy the peace of this quiet place in the heart of Condesa.

neiborhood_overview:
Santa MarÃ­a la Ribera is a fusion of history and the modern world, combining great architectural and historical value with a shopping mall, restaurants, and much more. It is considered the first modern subdivision of Mexico City. First emerging in 1861, Santa MarÃ­a is filled with houses embedded with a long history, many preserved to this day: a glimpse into the world of the late nineteenth century. Some key examples are:
â¢Casa de los Mascarones (âHouse of the Masksâ)
â¢Museo Universitario del Chopo (âChopo University Museumâ)
â¢Alameda de Santa MarÃ­a, with its Moorish and Chinese inspirations, built for the Universal Exhibition of New Orleans of 1884
â¢Museo de GeologÃ­a de la UNAM (âMuseum of Geology of UNAMâ)

Santa MarÃ­a la Ribera is a fusion of history and the modern world, combining great architectural and historical value with a shopping mall, restaurants, and much more. It is considered the first modern subdivision of Mexico City. First emerging in 1861, Santa MarÃ­a is filled with houses embedded with a long history, many preserved to this day: a glimpse into the world of the late nineteenth century. Some key examples are:

description:
My studio is located in the heart of la CONDESA, one of the best and most walkable neighbourhoods in Mexico City.
You'll enjoy taking a stroll through Parque MÃ©xico and Avenida Amsterdam, taking a coffee break at one of many fabulous cafÃ©s, shopping at some of the trendiest shops and boutiques and having dinner at some of Mexico City's most delicious restaurants.
Come visit soon!

The space
Located on the 8th floor of a 16 floor apartment building, this studio is the perfect base for anyone who wants to discover what Mexico City has to offer.
There is one bedroom with a double bed, a living room with a sofa that converts into a double bed, one and a half bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, a laundry room with a washer/dryer and a terrace with a great sunset view.
The bedroom has no door so it's important you are familiar with whomever you're sharing the flat with.
The building has 24 hour security and an elevator.

This is a large private room in a corner apartment of Mexicoâs Cityâs Central Historic district. It is only 4 blocks from El Zocalo, La Catedral, Bellas Artes, and myriad of great cafes, restaurants, markets, shopping and amazing bakeries! The room gets plenty of light.The living room, bathroom and kitchen are shared. Spanish and English is spoken in house. Short walk to metro.

The space
This is a large room in a beautiful and historic area of the city. From here you can walk to El Zocalo, Bellas Artes and many museums, tourist attractions, restuarants and bars. We are two blocks from La Regina, a pedestrian-only street with wonderful restaurants, bars, cafes, and great for people watching. We are also only a 15 minute metro ride from La Roma and Condessa. From our apt you take public transport to anywhere in the city.

name: 5B - Suite Cultura de San Angel - 1BR/1BA Double
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi. For full guest reviews see: https://www.airbnb.ca/rooms/5750208

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Ange
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

name: Perfect location - appartment in Polanco
description:
This modern appartment is the perfect choice. The appartment is 5 minutes away from the heart of Polanco, one of the cities most popular suburbs. It also has a subway station around the corner and you can walk to the cities main attractions (museums and castillo de Chapultepec). It is surrounded by all types of restaurants suiting all budgets. The flat is spacious and cozy, decorated with a modern Mexican style.

The space
The appartment is fully renovated and has a simple and modern Mexican style. You will get a feeling of coziness immediately. The location is also unique and quite convenient.

Guest access
- 1 main bedroom
- TV room / guest room with sofa bed
- Each bedroom with its private bathroom
- Living area, with dining table and open kitchen bar

- Nice balcony

host_about: I consider my self as an easy outgoing person...love quality time with family and friends, but also enjoy having my own space. I like to have a space where I feel at home and where I can enjoy myself. I might not be known for being the most organised person, but my house is clean and tidy. I love outdoor life, love the ocean in particular. I was born in Mexico City although I just came back after 10 years living in Australia. I recently renovated my flat and have put a lot of effort to make it feel my home again, and it is now. I am myself rediscovering Mexico City and this is the perfect location to do it. Colonia EscandÃ³n is a popular district that stands out for its cheerful and relaxed atmosphere and its magnificent geographical location, having as neighbors the Condesa, Roma Sur and Napoles districts, as well as Chapultepec and Reforma Avenue in less than 15 minutes.

A delicious bakery next door. Also stores of specialized regional products (honey, mezcal, artisan corn tortillas), a market opposite where you can buy your vegetables, meats, coffee, seeds or go to eat delicious. And I don't forget the ice cream parlors and seafood restaurants ...

name: cosy apartment near UNAM in coyoacan
description:
The apartment is located in a residential area, near the National University, in the neighborhood of Copilco, within Coyoacan (Mexico City). Coyoacan is ten minutes away by car or metro. Metro Copilco station is right by the entrance to the Condominium. The apartment is cosy, warm in winter and fresh in the summer. It has ample windows, fully furnished, spacious, and has ample windows for natural light.

The space
The apartment has two full bedrooms, one with en-suite. There are two living rooms, one dining area, a fully equipped kitchen, and two full bathrooms. On request, we can also include a private parking space.

The residential area has private security and cameras for safety and peace of mind.

The space is ideal for solo travelers, couples, or families with up to three children. There are 3 beds and 2 sofas. The sofas do not convert to bed. They can be used, however, as a bed for small children.

host_about:
Holaa!

Greetings from a Mexican heart, my name is Daniel and Iâm thrilled to tell you about who I am and what I like.

I speak Spanish, English & Music (yes, it is also a language) I love music, I want to dedicate my life to learning, playing and listening to it around the world. I myself play guitar, piano and sing. 

I am also in the process of writing a book and Iâm currently developing an app too.

Iâm Buddhist coming from a Jewish family and I will always be up for a good meal and chat. I like to go out as much as I enjoy my own company. I am organized (some would say too much) and I always take care of those I love and matter to me.

Iâm currently on a 5 month trip around the USA on a journey to discover my own music as well as the history behind it, while I grow and explore what it means to grow up (I guess we all have to at some point)

Iâm very excited to get to know the world and learn from it.

If youâre a host, you read this, and youâre still thinking about taking me in or not, you have to know something very important before you make your mind... 

...I make killer poached eggs.

I hope this arrives well and Iâll be around if you ever want to talk.

Hasta pronto!
