name: Huge room in downtown, colonial Coyoacan!
description:
Miau! Wanna dive straight into meaning and share our sweet space? We offer a fully furnished beauty for you to inhabit. The room's almost like a small loft, with its private bathroom. More so, you'll love our apartment, an interesting and homely place, with a sunny garden and a large kitchen. Me (Gon, sensuality incarnate), Banzai (my fellow ð), Duca (an impetuous ð), and IvÃ¡n (the ðµ I share with her) will introduce you into Frida's CoyoacÃ¡n and CDMX, most generally. Come pet us! Now! ðº

The space
The room we offer is huge--really. It's fully furnished: with a brand new king-sized bed, its own, private bathroom, a TV, lots of drawers and closet space, a writing desk, and other niceties. We're positive you'll love it!

Our apartment is also fully furnished, functional and, to my judgement, quite interesting to look at and comfortable to live in. Located where Mexico's colonial past and modern present coincide, our place can be described as a curated C
host_about:
I'm a curious, friendly and resourceful native from beautiful CoyoacÃ¡n, Ciudad de MÃ©xico. I love collecting objects and trying new things--hence my interest in all things cultural, technology and, well, Airbnb. I also lived abroad for quite a while, so I learned the value intercultural exchange and to enjoy home sharing. More so, I've been told that I'm a kind host and graceful guest--though I'll let you be the judge of that.

Personally, I like reading (things like social theory, news, and science fiction, e.g.), 3D printing, games, meditation and, well, just watching the world. I'm also a tolerant, happy vegetarian, though I try to remain musically omnivorous.

I'll be delighted to meet you, for sure :)

Polanco is a neighborhood of Mexico City, located in the north of it in the mayor of Miguel Hidalgo. It is called Polanco because it designates two large colonies, Polanco Chapultepec and Polanco Reforma.

The area is the headquarters of cultural venues such as museums and galleries; companies, embassies, and leisure businesses such as restaurants, luxury shops, and shopping malls, highlighting President Masaryk Avenue. It is characterized by its cultural diversity and has historically been preferred by the descendants of Spaniards, Ashkenazi Jews, Lebanese, among others.

Most of its streets and avenues were named after people who made great contributions to science or literature.

name: Cozy&Sunny flat with AC, 40MB in historic downtown
description: Brand new anti-seismic building. Cozy apartment, 40MB Internet, Bedroom with AC & 24hrs security. Laundry room in the basement, Gym, and Rooftop garden with an amazing view. Modern, clean & well located in the historical downtown district. Walking distance from everything! (Zocalo, Bellas Artes). 2 Subway stations next door, half a block for the Bus station and a City bikes station. Just 10min distance by car/taxi from Polanco, Condesa & La Roma, the city's best foodie & nightlife areas.
host_about:
Hi, I am Claudia!
After living in London and Seville, I decided to go back to my city and I love it! I like to travel, meet new people and  try new food; I studied communications, work in a public relations agency and practice Bikram yoga.
I was born in Mexico City and I love living here because it is a fascinating place, I'd be glad that you come!!! and I'll be happy to give you recommendations for eating, visiting and discovering the "chilango" lifestyle.
*********************

neiborhood_overview:
Stay here will allow you to enjoy the typical neighborhood atmosphere of the historic downtown of the city and at the same time be very close to the trendiest and fun areas to going out for a drink, concerts, theaters, dancing and eat delicious.
Embrace the Centro neighborhood vibe and walk to the Mercado de San Juan, the ZÃ³calo, Bellas Artes and the Alameda Park. You are in the historical district of the city, so enjoy the architecture and the energy of the downtown' streets.
Jump in the MetroBus and in just 20 minutes you will be in the heart of the Chapultepec Forest! Take a walk and visit the Castle, the National Museum of Antropology or the Tamayo Museum full of Mexican and International art.
Only two blocks away is the Mexico Arena, the home of Lucha Libre!!!! So you can not miss one of the most typical and fun shows in the city.
Just in the corner you will see the TuriBus, jump in!!! I highly recommend it!!! Is the best opciÃ³n to see all the city in 1day.

-We have an equipped kitchen: microwave, coffee maker and Dolce Gusto coffee maker. Including special pans to use the oven.

- Also, the internet works very well for all our guests who work from home.

With the gorgeous Lincon Park right in the corner of my home is one of the trendiest spots in Mexico City. The apartment with big open spaces, comfy beds and a huge window of light youâll get the awesome vibe of the city.

The space
The apartment is brand new, with new deco and open spaces, but with house charm of a traditional house, with two entire bedrooms the apartment has no problem to locate 4 people comfy, even an additional one if you need to. With a full equipped kitchen with microwave, conventional oven and a small breakfast area its perfect for long stays. The really nice blend of colors of the walls goes along with the area you are staying. Blackout and privacy shades for all the apartment.

One of the biggest advantages of living in Polanco is that everything is very close to home - many of its inhabitants find that it is not even necessary to have a car! If you are looking for a coffee shop, an excellent meal, a special bottle of wine, designer clothes, a supermarket, a bookstore or a good haircut you do not have to look beyond Polanquito where all this and more can be found in very few Blocks

Polanquito is a small but densely packed area of shops, restaurants and fun in the heart of Polanco, steps away from Lincoln Park. In fact, many of the area's most popular restaurants line up along the park and its terraces offer an unbeatable vantage point to enjoy the beauty of the park and observe its activity. Some of our favorite places to enjoy a good meal or dinner are Primos Hermanos with their delicious Mexican-Mediterranean food and excellent cuts of meat, Mythos if you like Greek or Ivoire food if your thing is international food in a refined atmosphere. name: Just Refreshed -  Secluded - Patio and Terrace
description:
This house has a vintage character. The high ceilings make the space bigger, the house orientation and the oversize windows provide very good light. The house is very quiet and intimate the patio and the terrace are perfect for enjoying the mild weather of the city. The location forms a triangle with the Condesa and Roma Norte being 2 blocks from Insurgentes street and half block from Medellin market. The deco is intentionally sober to create a relaxing environment.

The space
The house is on ground level with the benefit of spacious rooms. The kitchen and the dinning room have access thru the patio. Ideal for three and comfortable for five as well, this is an independent space but in combination with house on the front (1920 tile house I) could be a excellent place for a big group travelling together.

The main bedroom has a queen bed and a walking closet, this room has a little patio on the back that works as a private relaxing space.

The
host_about:
I will treat my guest as I would like to be treated when I travel making their experience an enjoyable one. 

The places I offer are meant to be comfortable, clean and have specific locations for visiting the city. Every place is unique and it has been thought for enjoyment of the guests.

name: Beautiful penthouse Room at the Heart of the City
description:
Beautiful Private Room inside a Great penthouse at a traditional residential area in the City, complete with Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, Laundry, Tv Room, Studio, 2 huge balconies and 2 Roof Gardens. Located 2 blocks away form main avenue Insurgentes, Subway Stations, Metrobus Station and a Public bike station. 2 Blocks away from 2 major parks in the city, restaurants, coffee shops, theaters and 15 min away from trendy condesa and 40 min away from the airport.

The space
Ample Queen Bedroom with private bathroom and closet, with its own balcony and private terrace, very well lit from huge windows, with screens and blackout curtains. Enjoy good linens & pillows for a good night sleep. The apartment is very well located in a quiet street but still in the middle of the city, located 1 block away from famous Insurgentes and next to bus stops and subway, very close from 3 beautiful parks full of restaurants and local cuisine.

Guest access

neiborhood_overview:
At walking distance two shopping malls: Perisur and Plaza Inbursa Cuicuilco, full of restaurants and movie theaters. Close by is the biggest stadium in Mexico: The "Estadio Azteca, el Coloso de Santa Ursula" home to two soccer football teams and popular venue for events and music concerts. Also less than two miles away is Six Flags amusement park, and several museums like Universum Sciences Museum and MUAC Contemporary Art Museum.

Across the street is one of the oldest Mesoamerican sites in the valley: Cuicuilco, a cradle of the Mexico Valley civilizations and the forerunner of the Teotihuacan civilization. Close by there are several major parks and ecological reserves.

Ten minutes away is Tlalpan center (Tlalpan centro), this center, despite being in the urbanized zone, still retains much of its provincial atmosphere with colonial era mansions and cobblestone streets.

A lot of places to eat, from small street vendors to upscale restaurants. Ask me if

name: Lovely apartment in Condesa neighborhood!
description:
Beautiful antique and safe apartment strategically located in Condesa one of the most trendy neighborhoods in the city, with two lovely traditional parks just a few blocks away, in excellent condition and recently remodeled, fully furnished retro style with original designs from the 50âs and 60âs, spacious and well-lit, quiet, surrounded by nice restaurants and bars, several public transportation options and centrally located to get to almost anywhere in the city.

The space
Building with 24/7 security. A spacious bright and comfortable living and dining room, perfect for relaxing or working, two bedrooms each with storage space, the main one with a double bed and TV included, the second one with two single beds, both sunny and with external view, a small but fully equipped kitchen with microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker.

A great option for a couple looking for privacy or a family traveling together!

Guest access
Washer and
host_about:
I was born and raised in Mexico City, between Roma and Condesa neighborhoods, I'm an architect by profession, but for the last 13 years I have been designing and manufacturing slow design jewelry, I am a lover of art, design, history, and literature. I love traveling, sharing with people from different cultures and backgrounds!

I love my city, its extensive cultural, artistic and gastronomic offer, I enjoy walking or cycling, I have visited most of its museums and I am familiar with its history.

I know almost every corner of my neighborhood and much of the city, I can gladly guide you to enjoy your visit to the fullest!

I am gluten allergic, as such, I can support you to know how to survive with gluten-free conditions in my city. It will be a pleasure to be your hostess!

description:
Our 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment is located in the heart of Colonial CoyoacÃ¡n, one block from the Conchita Chapel (the oldest in the Americas), one block from the F. Kahlo Park, and 5min walk from the historic center CoyoacÃ¡n. This gorgeous apartment is extremely quiet, with a beautiful vista, lots of natural light, and close to two metro lines. Supermarket, restaurants and cafes two blocks away. Everyone is welcome in this apartment (we welcome long term rentals)-you will love staying here!

The space
The apartment is extremely quite and receives lots of sunlight, with a beautiful view from the living room. And the apartment is located in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Mexico City. The apartment has a landline from which you can call for FREE (unlimited phone calls) to any place in Mexico and anywhere in the world--yes, you read it correctly: unlimited free phone calls to anywhere in the world! We look forward to host you soon!

description:

The top floor of the building only has two apartments (and you are one of them). The elevator takes you straight up. Just opposite the apartmentâs entry door, there is a large open rooftop deck that you have access to this common area of the building. Subways are 4 to 8 blocks nearby the appartment.

The space
One of its main advantages is the location in La Condesa and between 15 and 20 minutes walking are the following places: Bosque de Chapultepec, Reforma, Polanco, Colonia Roma, Torre Mayor, Torre Bancomer, WTC, Museum of Anthropology and Museum of Modern Art .

Guest access
In addition to the privacy offered by the apartment, they can make use of the roof garden (which is directly opposite), but you need to communicate us that you are going to use it

name: Mexican Style apartment, Heart of Xochimilco
description:
Warm and spacious apartment in the Heart of Xochimilco; Within walking distance of lots of tourist attractions like "Las Trajineras", and downtown Xochimilco and many more in the area.
The apartment is the perfect place to Walk and return to a pleasant and confortable space to rest with family or friends.

The space
The private apartment has 2 Bedrooms, a spacious living room with a sofa bed, a sunny Terrace and the Kitchen full in colors and nature, It is the perfect Mexican corner in the south of the Mexico City to stay.

Guest access
The apartment has a Kitchen with accessories, small patio for sunbathing and spacious and bright living room with dining area for 6.
The Living rom has a sofa-bed and Hammock to read and relax.

neiborhood_overview:
Xochimilco is full of History, it is a neighborhood that you can walk, where you will find in the streets and alleys small plazas and old churches which festivities all year.

The market of Xochimilco is located 4 Blocks away, one of the largest traditional markets in Mexico City with regional food, and traditional objects.

One of the small piers, where you can take a Trainer to tour the famous chinampas is located 2 blocks from the apartment, the main piers are 10 and 15min. walking.

All tourist attractions are available any day of week, all year round.

name: Unique colonial apartment / Historic neighborhood
description:
This private apartment, in colonial style, is a semi-independent part of our property. Located on the second floor, full of light, cozy, and with a fabulous view of an exuberant garden decorated with sculptures. Planned for travelers from all over the world with a taste for discovery.

Beautiful and pedestrian-friendly San Angel is full of restaurants, coffee shops, art galleries, museums and art markets. The apartment is an easy walking distance to metro bus and University (UNAM) subway line.

The space
This apartment is designed for travelers who come to Mexico because of its culture, as well as business people. The apartment lends itself for prolonged stays. It is located on the second floor with a wonderful and relaxing view to trees.

Fully furnished, with many commodities, to include TV, internet connection, kitchen/dining room, living room, and bedroom with its own private bath.

Guest access
Please make yourself
host_about:
We are a working couple. Hector is a medical doctor and Marie-Louise signs her artwork Olyn. We have travelled all over Mexico and other parts of the world. Aside from travelling we are scuba divers and nature lovers. Olyn reads very much and loves music, and simply lives.  Hector is always updated on local and international politics and the cultural events of the city. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Somos una pareja que trabajamos mucho. Hector es medico y Marie-Louise escogio como nombre de artista visual, Olyn. Hemos viajado por Mexico y muchas otras partes del mundo. Ademas practicamos el buceo subacuatico y nos gusta la naturaleza. Olyn lee mucho y a Hector le gusta mantenerse al tanto de la cultura y de los acontecimietos nacionales e internacionales.

The space

Je parle franÃ§ais and i speak English to

neiborhood_overview:
I live in currently one of the most emblematic areas for its history and location. My neighborhood feels safe, even at night. It is located close to many parks. Within a block of the apartment, you can find many restaurants for any taste-- Mexican, vegan, juice, ice cream, coffee, buffet, etc. There are some late-night spots very close if you are arriving or get hungry late at night. Additionally, there are a lot of 24-hour convenience stores and restaurants just one block away. The food possibilities are endless around my space.

There is a local market a few blocks away, and a couple big supermarkets 10 minutes away by foot. There is a laundromat and hair salon just across the street.

host_about:
Hi travelers! I am a Mexican Mkt, PR consultant and now becoming a writer. I had the privilege to study some courses in Cuba, Spain and Germany a couple of years ago and since then I can't stop traveling.

Countries that I love most, including my country:
Italy
Mexico
Portugal
India
Turkey

Cities that I love most:
Bangkok
Berlin
Cascais
Istanbul
Lisbon
London
Madrid
Mexico City
New York

Tokyo

What I like to read: any novel, although lately I have been very interested in ny book that allows me to understand a country and its culture.

Love to practice sports and eat a loooooot of pastries, bakery and fruits. 

I rarely go out at night. Definitely not a party man, rather chilly atmospheres. 

;)

The kitchen and shared bathroom have all the necessary to make your stay more comfortable. Monthly fee includes services (water, electricity, gas, and internet). The space
The apartment is ideal for a couple or to share between 2-3 roomies, as it has two spacious and functional rooms (the first with a queen bed and the second with a single bed, plus a desk and a bookshelf). Both bedrooms have their wardrobe and bedding (so you do not worry, initially, about that). The apartment is very bright and very well ventilated (large windows, high ceilings). Super pleasant to look at and full of beautiful details (the wooden floor makes it very comfortabl
host_about: Benny, Teodoro, my books, the music, the sea und radfahren/spazierengehen are the things I cannot live without. I love to eat and drink mezcal. A long joyful chat with friends. Love to laugh and to listen any kind of stories. Curious about what happens out there, my time has come to move on and explore a new country and new ways of living. Nevertheless my friend Rudy in presence (and I via Airbnb) would be really happy to welcome people from all around the world. Feel free to ask, feel free to experience the chaotic Mexico City by yourself. Were are here to help you feel welcome.

name: Casa Real Condesa
description:
We host TWO INDEPENDENT AND PRIVATE ROOMS, each one with its own bathroom.
The first room, accounts for a king size bed and full across-the-wall closet and TV, besides its own private bathroom.
The second room counts with two twin-size beds, large flat screen TV, full custom built closet and its own private bathroom with independent entrance from the patio. We share Living and dinning room, kitchen, Patio with Umbrella and BBQ.

The space
Located in one of the best neighborhoods in Mexico City, Casa Real Condesa offers you the opportunity to get to and from any places in a variety of ways. Famous for its young ambience and nigh life, our neighborhood is well known for its bar scene, restaurants and rapidly growing startup community.

Your ride from/to the airport is about 30+ minutes on a regular day, but could take longer given rain or traffic conditions. Uber is always a great and affordable way to get around.

The house is rig

host_about:
My real name is Veronica but I like to be called Veritl. ItÂ´s a name I invented in Nahuatl.
Veritl = Woman always restless with adventures in the head.
I'm 46 years old. I love to tell people how old I am because it always increases my desire to live.
I love my beautiful Mexico City and I love that anyone who visits it either for pleasure or business will have the best experience. That's why I decided to share my life experience and my Mexican house: a place to just explore who you are.
I like a lot, a lot of things: eating, laughing, exercising, reading, learning, dressing, photographing, listening, talking and shutting up, but above all, I like to walk. ItÂ´s something I enjoy excessively. I love to walk in all the different ways possible.  Walking with my eyes, is my favorite.
*****
Mi verdadero nombre es VerÃ³nica pero gusta que me digan Veritl segÃºn yo es mi nombre  en Nahuatl.
Veritl= Mujer inquieta siempre con aventuras  en la cabeza.
Tengo 46 aÃ±os pero creo que tengo 47, me encanta decir los aÃ±os que tengo ya que creo que la edad siempre aumenta mis ganas de vivir.
Amo mi hermosa  Ciudad de MÃ©xico y me encanta que todo aquel que la visite ya sea de placer o de negocios se lleve la mejor de las experiencia. Por eso decidÃ­ compartir mi experiencia de vida  y mi  casa mexicana: un lugar para volver a ser quien eres, ese que pocas veces sale a luz, pero que cuando sale te sorprende, porque aunque lo llevas dentro muy pocas veces sales de viaje con Ã©l. 
Me gustan mucho, muchas cosas:comer, reÃ­r,  hacer ejercicio, leer, aprender, vestir, fotografiar, escuchar, hablar y callar  pero  de todo lo que me gusta  para mÃ­ caminar es algo que disfruto en exceso. Amo caminar de todas las formas existentes. Caminar con los ojos, mi preferida.

description:
Cozy, sunny & airy bedroom with private bathroom. Great location, the neighbourhood, Polanco, is very safe and very convenient for tourists and executives working on the area. Walking distance to all the best shopping (Antara and Palacio de Hierro), restaurantes, and museums. Close to public transportation and different points of interest in the city.

The space
The apartment is spacious, bright and airy, open, comfortable and friendly. Your room has a private bathroom, a double bed, large closet and a desk for your laptop. The room is ideal for one person , but a second guest is also welcome. Fresh/clean sheets and towels. Coffee machine in your room and access to the kitchen and itÂ´s utensils as well. Although the room and the entire apartment is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized, you will have Lysol and alcohol at your disposal in the room.
ThereÂ´s a dog on the property, a friendly and quiet old lady (half Golden and half Cocker).

Guest acces

name: Room at my place in Condesa
description:
As airbnb gets more popular it loses its original concept: a person that opens a home to offer real life experience in the destination. My home welcomes any guests willing to become our roommates during their staying. Living with us and learning with us. Pola my labrador and me, will be happy to have you home.

My place has been better enjoyed by startups entrepreneurs and first time travelers to the city.

The space
**IMPORTANT: I only receive guests that are registered on airbnb, do not book this place if you are not the same person that is going to stay.

Your bedroom has a bunk bed (full + twin bed). Closet with a lot of space. A desk for work. Take into consideration that despite of the two beds, the accommodation is for one person only.

The main bedroom is where I sleep, but occasionally could be used by another guest when I am out of town.

Kitchen fully equipped. Washer and dryer machine can be used.

Des
host_about:
Notebook binder, entrepreneur and film producer. I also am a mother of a 21 young man.

name: Lovely KingSize Room in shared apt. near Condesa
description:
Enjoyable King Size bedroom in a warm and cozy 115m 2 vintage style shared apartment, super located for short or mid term stays , just 2 blocks from famous Condesa neighborhood and well connected. We are on 2nd and top floor with high ceilings and wooden floor, a small but fully equipped kitchen, a small office, studio and a shared bathroom. Grocery stores, restaurants and good bakery just around the corner. Ecobici, Metrobus Escandon and Metro within walking distance.

The space
The all wooden floor place is in 2nd and top floor of a very well located building close to Condesa, Napoles, having public bike station, Metrobus or metro just in walking distance. It has high ceilings gets nice sunlight during the day. There is a 3B super market around the corner and a delicious bakery close by and going out for lunch is much cheaper than 2 blocks further in condesa. I use to work in the office/studio during the day, since I have no third roomie there at the moment. An
host_about: After sharing a flat with AirBnB guests for some years in Mexico City I first got a guest myself travelling to New York City. Now I am a host myself and feel excited to welcome guests to one of the most vibrant cities in the world. So feel free to message me for anything I can give information about and enjoy your day!

neiborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is a typical one in Mexico City, it's located in front of Foro Sol and the F1 AutÃ³dromo Hnos. RodrÃ­guez, near from the Palacio de los Deportes, which makes it a very popular neighbourhood. It's also 10 minutes from Mexico City's Airport. One of the main avenues is Avenida 8, four blocks away from the flat where you'll find any type of shops and services, as well as the well-known market Zaragoza, where you can find: fresh fruit and vegetables, juices, shakes, ice-cream, typical mexican food, home-made food and every ingredient if you want to cook at the flat. There's an Oxxo (convenience store) two blocks away, Bancomer, Banamex and other banks really near, there's also a Walmart  8 minutes away. If you don't feel like going too far, you'll find many stores around the flat as well as places to have breakfast, lunch and dinner typical mexican food (barbacoa, enchiladas, menudo or pancita, pozole, birria, quesadillas, tacos, etc.) and also to have a beer/drink you can fi

neiborhood_overview: The Zona Rosa is currently the largest recreation area in Mexico City, where cafes, bars and nightlife are mixed with an atmosphere of freedom and acceptance. It is a magical neighborhood, emerged as a stage where art was promoted and intellectuals met. Today, the Zona Rosa attracts people from all over the world for its cafes, bars and nightlife. During the day, the streets of the Zona Rosa fill with people who come and go, fulfilling various tasks; at midday their restaurants are filled with tourists, employees and clerks looking for food; the late-night lends itself to leisurely walk its streets and alleys, coexisting with all kinds of people who come to see and be seen; and later, to enjoy the nightlife.

name: Big Room in Narvarte, close to everything you need
description:
Great place for those who enjoy staying in big spaces. The room is pretty big (17m2). The location is central and near to bars, restaurants, supermarkets, shopping malls and a park. Also the public transportation is pretty close (walkable); Metrobus is just half a block away and Subway (Metro) is 3 blokcs. The neighborhood is safe, you can walk at any time (just avoid wear fancy clothes and/or accessories). I'm pretty sure my place will be ideal for your short staying in Mexico City.

The space
My apartment was recently restyled. During the day, it is illuminated with a lot of natural light and is also big. You will notice that is kind of minimalist, because we don't like to have many furnitures but with the basic you will feel very comfortable.

Guest access
You can spend part of the day at the living room reading, drinking a coffee, having a conversation or just hanging around your social network with your cell phone.
host_about: I'm a very respectful and calm person. I love to enjoy a cup of coffee and a conversation.

Guest access

host_location: San CristÃ³bal de Las Casas, Mexico
host_about: I'm a Mexican journalist, interested in politics, visual arts, independent movies and theater. I'm an open minded and easy going person who loves nature, traveling and adventure. I enjoy meeting new people and sharing ideas, moments and experiences. I think we came to this world to enjoy life and try to reach happiness in a responsible way. If we can, we should help others to reach happiness too. I love Mexico and latin american culture, including its music and its spontaneity. However, I feel very attracted to French culture, Paris and Montreal are, for instance, my favorites cities. My favorite movie is probably "The Pillow Book" from Peter Greenaway and my preferred cuisines are Mexican and Japanese.

name: CÃ³modo, cÃ©ntrico y relajante departamento
description: CÃ©ntrico, cÃ³modo, acogedor y cÃ©ntrico con todos los servicios bastante accesibles. Centros Comerciales, Gimnasios, Parques, Museos, Restaurantes y Centros de Negocios cerca. Perfecto para viaje de negocios o simplemente vacacionar por la Ciudad.
host_about:
NÃ³mada por naturaleza, apasionado por la diversidad y la cultura popular mexicana y los pueblos indÃ­genas del mundo. Me encanta viajar, siempre que tengo la oportunidad lo hago, no hay lugar del mundo (y del Universo) al que no quiera ir, me gusta conocer gente, aprender de otras culturas, otros idiomas, probar diversidad de comidas. Soy soÃ±ador e idealista, pero me gusta aterrizar mis ideas y alcanzar mis metas. AMO MÃ©xico y soy fan de demostrarle eso a cada gente que visita la Ciudad o el paÃ­s, y siempre estoy dispuesto a compartir experiencias y lugares de los estados de MÃ©xico que ya conozco (27 de 32). Siempre que puedo llevo mi cÃ¡mara y mi mascota, tengo buena memoria, pero un buen recuerdo en una buena foto, nunca estÃ¡ de mÃ¡s. Estar en contacto con la naturaleza es bÃ¡sico para mÃ­, prefiero un bosque con lluvia, una selva llena de sonidos y una playa donde pueda intentar surfear y ver un atardecer/amanecer, que a una Ciudad. Me declaro fan del cielo y de la luna, de las estrellas y del Universo.
I am cool & relaxed guy. I am an environmental lawyer, passionate by nature, Mexican popular art and worldÂ´s indigenous peoples. I am a globe trotter, couchsurfer and hitchhiker and every time I have the chance to travel, I JUST DO IT, thereÂ´s no place in the world (nor the Universe) that I donÂ´t wanna visit. I love meeting new people (real meaning of meeting), to learn from other cultures and other languages, to try different foods. I am a dreamer and an idealist though I always try to land my ideas and to achieve my goals. I AM TOTALLY IN LOVE WITH MEXICO and every chance is a good chance to tell it to anybody, no matter Mexican or foreigner. I like to exchange experiences from my own travel in Mexico and throw hints from all the places that I have been around Mexico (27 states from 32, not bad right). I love to travel with my camera and with my pet (if it is possible) I have good memory though a good picture is always welcome. To be in contact with the nature and let it flow through me is basic for me and a MUST. I rather to be in a rainy forest, in a jungle full of nature music and a beach for surfing and sunsets than a City. To watch the sky and the moon is one of my passions, I am a fan from the stars and the Universe.

name: Cozy and Centric TWO Bedroom Apartment
description:
Decorated with tons of love and memories from my trips, I invite you and your friends or family to stay at my two-bedroom apartment in la NÃ¡poles, just a few meters away from the WTC and walking distance to Condesa. Ideal if you wish to stay in a centric, quiet and secure area. Make yourselves at home at this cozy space!

The space
The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs. The stairs are pretty light (in my opinion), as the apartment is located in the 4th floor. .

When you enter the apartment you'll see the living room and the dining room. To the right is the kitchen, fully equipped for you to cook! and with a small Breakfast Bar.

There are two bedrooms: One with a Queen-sized bed and the other one with two twin beds. There's only one Bathroom. Moreover, the couch at the living room can easily become a bed
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

name: Centrally Located and Comfortable Apartment
description:
Reforma and the Historic Center at your feet. Metro station is around the corner. The building is brand-new and the furnishing comprises a mixture of modern and Mexican mid-century pieces. The location allows you to move by foot or public transit if your goal is to avoid traffic. Roma, Condesa, Polanco and La Basilica at 10-min drive if you rather prefer to save your steps. The apartment is fully equipped.

The apartment is confortable and secure, equipped with all necessary for a pleasant stay. Wifi and Netflix access provided. For coffee and tea lovers, a coffee maker, French press and teapot are available. Kitchen is also equipped with fridge, toaster oven, electric kettle, microwave and all the cookware necessary to make a gourmet meal. If you are in town for work, the apartment is equipped with a working space. I have included plenty of books about Mexico City and its favorite authors in case you want to immerse yourself in the culture.

Security 24/7. Self-che
host_about:
I am an architect from Chihuahua, a town located in the north of Mexico. I left my hometown like 10 years looking for traveling here and there and experience different cultures, food and places. My career landed me in Mexico City, where I have settled during the last years. I love the city because of its energy, cultural scene and excellent food at the best prices IÂ´ve seen! 

The city is huge and you donât really have to have a car to move around, there are a number of mobility options (Uber, metro, etc). In terms of safety, everything worth visiting is on pretty safe areas. My foreign friends, who have to travel by themselves during the day when Iâm at work, have moved around freely with no inconveniences - yet, if you want to save your energy, use Uber and the tour buses so you get a glimpse of the main areas, if you are here for more than one day you can try mastering the art of ridding public transport at non-peak hours. Remember, the metro is crowded but it goes everywhere and is super cheap!

As in any big city in the world, common sense comes a long way. Stay in well populated areas, and stay closer to the places you want to visit. That would make it easier to navigate the city.

Definitively leave driving to the locals, since traffic is crazy here, and drivers are not always friendly. However, if you really want to drive by yourself I recommend Waze as the app to guide you around, and leave your car only at self-service parking spots. Beware of parking restrictions if you park on the street.

This city has absolutely everything you can ask for. Sports, concerts, art, great food, archeology, shopping for any budget, history, and more. Try going during the breaks, when the locals go out on vacation and the place is not insanely crowded. The weather is also great in the spring, autumn and winter.

Safe travels!

host_about:
Architecture and nightlife have a common home in Mexico City with Juan Carlos Quintero (@Juan.carlosquintero), an architect whose other specialty is to organize âstreet beat projects,â which combine music, food and drinks in secret locations in one of the biggest cities in the world. âI stay away from commercial places and look instead for places with soul and meaning.â

For him the creativity comes from his homeland. âEverything in Mexico is overwhelming. There are overwhelming colors and textures. You even go to downtown Mexico City and thereâs an overwhelming amount of people. I find my inspiration from those textures and raw materials, but also from light and color.â

But beyond buildings and the night scene, thereâs a sense of purpose for Juan Carlos. âIâd like people to see that I live in a modern, cosmopolitan city, full of contrasts. I like to show that due to its cultural mix, Mexico City is one of the most influential cities in the world. Here you can find everything.â
neighbourhood: Mexico City, Ciudad de MÃ©xico, Mexico

description:
Beautiful and modern apt filled with natural light all day in a fantastic location in Downtown. Itâs close by to all attractions such as Zocalo, The Museum of Fine Arts, Torre Latino, Garibaldi, The Metropolitan Cathedral, La Alameda Central, and lots of Museums.

The space

neiborhood_overview:
NEIBORHOOD :
The neighboorhood is very well served. Out of the building there is a charm coffee shop where you can have breakfast if you donât want to cook.
Several restaurants, with all kind of cuisines, as well as leisure and cultural places can be found within a 500-meter radius.

Fine Art Museum is just 1block away, the MUNAL is just right away from the building, The Cathedral is 4 blocks away, Torre Latino is 1 block away.There are art cinemas, Mexican restaurants, coffee shops, shops, and a lot of attractions around.
Daily there is an open market just one block from the apt.

The apt is located in the best position to reach any part of the City by walk. 5 minutes to Garibaldi where you can hear a lot of Mariachis and see Mexican dances. 30 minutes from the Finance Dsitrict where the Angel of the Independence is located.

description:
Ideal for 4 or 5 companions. A Place Yours ... in CdMx means Total Exclusivity with your family or friends, comfort, cleanliness, zero urban noise. It consists of small dining room and kitchen, bathroom and bedroom with 2 beds + 1 single, located in condominium property, but with independence, tranquility, security and rest. Short access to metrobus, subway Bellas Artes 3 blocks, 12 minutes from Zocalo CdMx. People are welcome without excluding origin, or preferences of any kind.

The space
A place preserved in Centro Historico in CdMx, ideal to stay with your family or trusted friends (5), consists of 2 double beds and one single drawer (no sofa). In which you will find the necessary services with the privacy of home (kitchen, dining room, laundry and own clothesline with insurance, on the roof) and you can enjoy an environment outside new, multicultural and wonderful, such that with the fairest investment you will live with Mexico City at the door of your home.
host_about:
MatemÃ¡tico, con interÃ©s por la FilosofÃ­a, PsicologÃ­a, TeologÃ­a y Ãtica. Amante de la mÃºsica romÃ¡ntica, la poesÃ­a,  los libros y el Conocimiento en general.   Regla de oro en mi pensamiento: "Existe una sola raza, la humanidad", "Ama y haz lo que quieras", "Soy internacional en la medida que cada dÃ­a soy mÃ¡s espiritual" "Vivir plenamente, nunca haciendo daÃ±o ni a sÃ­ mismo ni a los demÃ¡s", "Todo me es permitido, pero no todo me es constructivo..." , "Cada cultura es diferente y por tanto cada una aporta un sabor exquisito a eso que llamamos humanidad" "Lo mejor que el Hombre puede dejar a sus hijos o a su pueblo, es la educaciÃ³n basada en el Arte, Ciencia, ReligiÃ³n, FilosofÃ­a y Cultura", "Mientras el Hombre no tenga Paz en su interior, el mundo en Guerra vivirÃ¡","Me podrÃ­a rendir, pero esa opciÃ³n... no existe"

neiborhood_overview:
"Colonia Federa"l is one of the busiest areas near the City Airport. It is a neighborhood originally nicknamed 'the urban spider web' because its urban design resembles a spider web. It currently houses many students who attend Aviation Schools, but also Airport workers who have found their perfect location here.

The neighborhood is very quiet and is well connected to the rest of the city. Right on the corner, you will find a convenience store open 24 hours a day. In the front part there is a public parking lot that is also open 24 hours a day, with rates per hour, day or month as required.

neiborhood_overview:
At walking distance two shopping malls: Perisur and Plaza Inbursa Cuicuilco, full of restaurants and movie theaters. Close by is the biggest stadium in Mexico: The "Estadio Azteca, el Coloso de Santa Ursula" home to two soccer football teams and popular venue for events and music concerts. Also less than two miles away is Six Flags amusement park, and several museums like Universum Sciences Museum and MUAC Contemporary Art Museum.

Across the street is one of the oldest Mesoamerican sites in the valley: Cuicuilco, a cradle of the Mexico Valley civilizations and the forerunner of the Teotihuacan civilization. Close by there are several major parks and ecological reserves.

Ten minutes away is Tlalpan center (Tlalpan centro), this center, despite being in the urbanized zone, still retains much of its provincial atmosphere with colonial era mansions and cobblestone streets.

A lot of places to eat, from small street vendors to upscale restaurants. Ask me if

name: SAN MIGUEL CHAPULTEPEC / LUNA ROOM
description:
At Casa San Miguel you will feel surrounded by peace and tranquility with its wonderful garden within the great city. Its magical feel offers a unique experience in Mexico City.
This magnificent property has 5 rooms of which each has a private bathroom.

The space
Casa San Miguel is a beautiful house that has many details of stone quarry and mahogany windows. It has a large garden in front of the house and a garden in the back with a pool (not enabled at the moment), which will make you feel as if you were in a magical town, being in the great city of Mexico.

Guest access
The back garden has a table and chairs where guests can have breakfast, read, work, smoke, etc.
The kitchen is spacious and is available to cook breakfast.
The two rooms and the dining room are closed during the day time, they are only open at Social Hour [cocktail hour] (6 pm-10pm / one free cocktail), where guests get to be social and know each other.

neiborhood_overview:
At walking distance two shopping malls: Perisur and Plaza Inbursa Cuicuilco, full of restaurants and movie theaters. Close by is the biggest stadium in Mexico: The "Estadio Azteca, el Coloso de Santa Ursula" home to two soccer football teams and popular venue for events and music concerts. Also less than two miles away is Six Flags amusement park, and several museums like Universum Sciences Museum and MUAC Contemporary Art Museum.

Across the street is one of the oldest Mesoamerican sites in the valley: Cuicuilco, a cradle of the Mexico Valley civilizations and the forerunner of the Teotihuacan civilization. Close by there are several major parks and ecological reserves.

Ten minutes away is Tlalpan center (Tlalpan centro), this center, despite being in the urbanized zone, still retains much of its provincial atmosphere with colonial era mansions and cobblestone streets.

A lot of places to eat, from small street vendors to upscale restaurants. Ask me if

neiborhood_overview: CuauhtÃ©moc named after the former Aztec leader, is one of the 16 boroughs of the Federal district of Mexico City. It consists of the oldest parts of the city, extending over what was the entire city in the 1920s. This area is the historic and cultural center of the city, although it is not the geographical center. While it ranks only sixth in population, it generates about a third of the entire city's GDP, mostly through commerce and services. It is home to the Mexican Stock Exchange, the important tourist attractions of the historic center and Zona Rosa, and various skyscrapers such as the Torre Mayor and the Mexican headquarters of HSBC. It also contains numerous museums, libraries, government offices, markets and other commercial centers which can bring in as many as 5 million people each day to work, shop or visit cultural sites.

description:
This stunning two story townhouse apartment is right on Av. Amsterdam in the heart of Condesa, one of the hippest, liveliest neighborhoods in Mexico City! Designed by arquitect Derek Dellekamp this beautiful apartment is decorated with all original art and design. Three bedrooms (1 queen, 2 twin beds) 2 full bathrooms, 1 half. Living room, reading room, fully equipped open kitchen with dining room and living room that open up to a huge terrace overlooking Av. Amsterdam. A true gem in the city!

The space
The original faÃ§ade of the building is from 1930's and still remains, the building was designed by renown architect Derek Dellekamp, he created a contemporary space within the historic one. The townhouse apartment has two stories, the rooms are located on the first floor and on the second is the open kitchen dining room and living room area with sliding glass doors that open up to a huge terrace overlooking Av. Amsterdam. So whether you want to sit on the terrace
host_about: My name is Ernesto, Iâm from Ciudad de Mexico. I own various restaurants around the city, including La Capital, one of the best Mexican food places in the area and El Malafama, a billiard hall and restaurant. I also am the proud owner of the best jazz club in Mexico City and Latin America El Zinco Jazz Club, so that will make it very easy for you to get reservations. ; ) I am also a painter and have my studio in Condesa. I have seen this neighborhood change and transform into what it is now. I love food, traveling and art. I have lived in various countries in America and in Europe and speak Spanish and English. It will be a pleasure to meet you and welcome you into my home.

name: Enjoy the Sun in a Stunning Colonia Roma Apartment's Terrace
description:
Travel in style in this gorgeous, spacious and modern apartment in the city's best location. Roma is the city's trendiest neighborhood and this apartment on Colima Street is two blocks away from its heart, with plenty of great options for dinning, shopping and sightseeing.

The building stands behind a recently restored classic Porfirian house, so you have modern amenities alongside the classic architectural style that made Roma famous. It's set up for around the clock self check-in, and we're fully commited to following strict guidelines for cleaning and sanitizing in these trying times.

The apartment has a great layout with no wasted space whatsoever, and we've taken care to ensure that it's the kind of space that we would want to live in both in terms of absolute comfort and thoughtful decoration. It's located in a modern addition to an old Porfirian townhouse that's been recently gut renovated to preserve the iconic feel of the neighborhood in the front with m

neiborhood_overview:
Full of street life, the Roma neighborhood is one the city's premier spots to walk around and treat yourself to excellent restaurants, funky bars, hip stores and cool art galleries surrounded by some of the city's best architecture.

Roma is centrally located, allowing you to walk towards many of the city's other highlights such as Downtown, la Condesa, Reforma Avenue and Chapultepec Park and Castle.

name: 4 apartments in la Condesa for up to 26 people
description:
Sleep up to 26 people in 4 apartments in the same building located right between the two beautiful parks of la Condesa. Ideal for large groups. Loads of bars, two big playparks, restaurants, boutique shops, galleries, malls, cinemas, museums, markets and a good-size supermarket all within walking distance. Close to both Metro Sevilla and Sonora Metrobus stop.

The space
This listing is for 4 apartments located within the same building, reservations made via this listing mean that you have access to all four apartments. The distribution of the apartments is as follows:

5th floor Penthouse (Photo numbers 1-25): 3 en-suite bedrooms, 2 with queen-size beds and 1 with a kingsize bed plus a sofabed in the living room and a large terrace. 1 shared bathroom in addition to the 3 en-suites. Sleeps 8 people in total sharing beds, 4 people without sharing.

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the 'trendiest' areas in Mexico City and also one of the safest. It's full of great wee places to explore on foot including a wealth of bars, restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops.
Parque MÃ©xico and EspaÃ±a are great for wandering around or exercising - both have free open air gym facilities and jogging tracks - and are the perfect option if you have kids as they both have excellent play parks and are just 100 meters from the apartment.
If you fancy a bit more of an adventure the massive Chapultepec park is just 1km away, it's brilliant for running, walking, cycling or visiting the museums and huge free zoo inside it.
Roma neighbourhood is also just a stone's throw away which is another great neighbourhood, that's where you'll find Mercado Medellin, our favourite market for all things food related.

name: Frida Studio 2 - CoyoacÃ¡n
description:
Newly renovated, bright and cozy Loft located 10 min walking distance from Downtown Coyoacan, which is one of the most artsy, colorful and exciting parts of Mexico City. If you want to feel like a local but have all the privacy, this is your place!

The space
The loft is decorated with with a mixture of traditional and modern Mexican design together with vintage furniture. Everything is new including the bathroom and kitchen. Itâs big windows make it a beautifully illuminated place with the advantage that no neighbour windows are in front, which is very difficult to find in Mexico City and makes the space very bright and still private.
The kitchen is equipped with all you need for basic cooking, there is wifi, and of course clean towels and linen will be provided.
In case you are travelling with friends, there is a second loft on the third floor that can also be rented, with no elevator.

Guest access
Our guests have all the pri

neiborhood_overview:
Coyoacan is one of the oldest and most traditional neighborhoods of the city, it's a neighbourhood with colonial mansions, art galleries, museums, shops and restaurants surrounding charming squares. The area is very safe and you can walk or bike around. In Coyoacan there are several interesting museums, such as Frida Kahlo's Museum and Leon Trotsky's House. The apartment is also very near the National Cinematheque with an amazing program of world and Mexican cinema, restaurants and coffee shops and book stores.
If driving you may leave your car for the night in the big parking lot .

name: Room in the heart of CDMX Chapultepec Condesa Roma
description:
Nice and comfortable furnished room of 9m2 in a house with 8 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room and a large kitchen in the heart of the city. The house is intended for long rental periods, so you don't have to fear the constant change of roommates. The house was renovated in July 2019, so the installations are brand new.

The space
The house is located in the heart of the city very close we have super markets, stores, markets, restaurants, and the incredible chapultepec forest just a few streets away.
The house is spacious, ecological and very comfortable and is fully furnished, it was completely renovated in July 2019 and the facilities are under constant maintenance.
Access to the house/room is secured by several locks.

Guest access
The house is fully furnished and you can make use of the living room, large kitchen, dining room and bathrooms.

Other things to note
Someone will be at your arrival

neiborhood_overview:
The house is located in the heart of the city very close to super markets, stores, markets, restaurants, and the incredible Chapultepec forest just a few blocks away.
Just around the corner you will find a laundry service where you can wash your clothes and have them ironed if necessary. For smaller purchases we recommend the nearby Oxxo, which can be reached in about 5 minutes.
Do you like sports? The Centro Deportivo Chapultepec in Chapultepec Park offers a wide range of sporting activities. The Chapultepec Castle can be reached on foot in about 25 minutes. In addition, the park offers a number of museums, which is why art lovers will not miss out here. The trendy quarter of Condesa can be reached on foot in about 20 minutes. There are lots of bars and restaurants waiting for you to be discovered. The also famous district Polanco can be reached by public transport within half an hour or in 15 minutes by taxi. Polanco is ideal for shopping trips and clubbing.

neiborhood_overview:
As if it were the portal to the past, it is easy to identify where this journey begins: on the avenue Patriotismo stands out the Plaza Goya and its streets with the names of painters. This small park that heads Calle Goya, a straight cobblestone that leads to the heart of one of the oldest and most traditional places of the CDMX, Mixcoac.

When entering this neighborhood ("serpent in the cloud" in Nahuatl), it is unlikely that the traces of the past of one of the first communities that were formed after the conquest will go unnoticed. During its first years of life, the inhabitants dedicated themselves to small industry, such as the manufacture of textiles and floriculture, to the production of corn, wheat, fruits and pulque, and to a peaceful country life; it seems that Mixcoac is the rural soul within the urban landscape.

From that time, the memories of the small neighborhood that came by tram to the Historic Center through the Mexico Avenue (today Revolution), o

Amazing apartment in the centre of the best area in Mexico: Roma norte.

In the center of the city, the trendy Roma Norte neighborhood (Â¿you know the movie Roma?) is full of amazing places to discover walking around: art galleries, amazing restaurants, bars and parks (when you live in this incredible megalopolis, you need this!).

The space

host_about:

I'm an outdoor person, love all kind of sports (I run, hike and skydive a lot). I also love art and good food !

name: Suite in a Charming Colonial Villa in San Angel
description:
As guest at our house you can use all common areas like kitchen, living and dining room but above all the quiet garden. As we live in the same house you become part of our family and we can give you a deep insight into Mexican culture and life style.

Guests have access to the living area, kitchen, garden and laundry room.

We live in the house and will make your stay as pleasant as possible.

The villa is in a quiet location at the end of a âprivadaâ (cul-de-sac) in the western part of San Angel. Itâs a 15-minute stroll down cobbled streets to reach the historic center with its famous church and weekend markets.

San Angel is in the south of Mexico City. Most touristic areas are 30-45' drive away but you will appreciated the calm in this busy city and yet be close to most areas.

San Angel can easily be visited on foot, for further distances we recommend Uber or we can organize for a driver with car.

We can help you getting

Modern and renovated "Pet-friendly" apartment located within a residential complex with luxury amenities and a staff that will make sure your stay at Capitalia Living is safe, comfortable and unforgettable. Our amenities have been renovated for the comfort of our guests enjoy our gym, reading area, meeting rooms, Co-work, event room, snack machine, parking, playroom, terrace with grill, garden with children's play area.

The space
Modern and elegant fully furnished 2 bedroom apartment with half bath in the living area, dining area with table for 4 people, fully equipped kitchen with basic kitchen utensils, full set of dishes for 4 people, laundry area with washer and dryer, living room with screen and cable TV, desk, WIFI, master bedroom with king size bed, master bathroom with shower, linens and bathroom amenities and walk-in closet. We have a 2nd bedroom with king size bed, closet, bathroom with shower, linens and bathroom amenities. Parking and elevator, 24 hou
host_about:
We are Capitalia, we will be happy to welcome you to any of our properties.
Capitalia is a professional property management company that seeks to maximize the experience of our guests!
Our goal is for you to experience comfort, convenience, and safety. Our team will meet you upon arrival to explain everything you need to know about your stay, your neighborhood and the property so you can enjoy it from a local perspective. We want you to get to know the city where you are going to stay better with the help of our personal guide. We're here to help, we'll be quick to answer any questions, and our goal is to make sure you have a fabulous time and become the best lodging option in Mexico.

description:
Our spacious house has bright, practical and comfortable rooms for a person who seeks tranquility in the city and who wants to enjoy our scenic garden. The house is close to the Santa Fe Shopping Center, so it's in a practical place but away from the noise of the city. It also offers a unique experience in the city because you will be able to meet pet animals such as the vaquita Daisy, the pigs and our dinosaurs: the geese. Come and discover our mini city Ranch.

name: Fantastic home with garden in Mexico City downtown
description:
This 2 floors house is centrally located between the historic center (15 mns), the trendy neighborhood of Polanco and La condesa (10 mns). Located in a quiet street, it is just 2 blocks from the major landmark of the city "El Angel de la Independencia" . The house with its garden, terraces and fountain is an oasis in the middle of the busy city. Its european style architecture filled with mexican artwork and sculptures can host 5 people in a cozy 260 m2.

The space
The House is one of the few houses remaining in the neighborhood , 2 blocks from Reforma Ave, the main avenue in Mexico City. The Garden, the tile roof, the chimenea and the Artwork give to the place an unique atmosphere in the center of the city. Ideally located, It is close to lots of restaurants and bars.

neiborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very friendly and lively. You will find lots of different restaurants just one block from the house offering french, Japonese, Mexican, spanish  cuisine in a relax atmosphere. Crossing Reforma Avenue, two blocks from the house is the "Zona Rosa" with more bars and discotheques. Reforma Avenue where they use to organize events all year around is also nice to walk by. On Sunday, the avenue is reserved to bikes. Use the one in the house to experience Mexico in a different way.

name: Ideal remote work place near Polanco
description:
Located at a short distance from Polanco, Reforma, Chapultepec, and Granada, you will find everything you need for a productive, comfortable and convenient remote work experience.

Tastefully decorated and outfitted for home office, this place has a kitchen, laundry room, living room, dining room, high speed internet, printer, desk, two bedrooms, and two full bathrooms offer privacy for 2 co-workers or 2 couples with different work schedules.

The space
Fully furnished apartment located on the ground floor in a three-story building. It has one master bedroom with a queen-size bed, full bathroom, walk-in closet, and TV; the second bedroom with a double-size bed and closet; a second full bathroom; a kitchen including most common supplies, microwave, fridge, stove, coffee maker, toaster, oven, and purified drinking water; the laundry room has washer, dryer, and ironing board; a living room with Roku TV; a dining room, desk and high-speed internet.
host_about:
I am a business owner living in Mexico City. Most of my travels are work related and I enjoy taking a break to get to know a new town or city.

As a host, I make sure my guests have a convenient and comfortable space to work and rest.

As a guest, I am respectful, quiet and clean, and will take good care of your home.

neiborhood_overview:
The place is in a busy residential and office area located in a well connected neighborhood next to Polanco in the Miguel Hidalgo borough.

Distances from:
Mexico City airport: 30 min drive.
Polanco: 15 min walk / 5 min drive.
Downtown (historic center): 25 min drive.
Roma / Condesa neighborhoods: 15 min drive.
Reforma / Chapultepec: 15 min drive
Granada: 10 min drive

You will not find bars, nightclubs, trendy restaurants/coffee shops or tourist attractions within this neighborhood since it is mainly residential and offices.

You will find everything you need for a convenient stay: supermarkets, drugstores, convenience stores, office supply stores, gyms, restaurants, parking garages, banks and dry cleaners.

It is a good option if you don't want to be in the middle of the touristic neighborhoods but near them. It gets busy during office hours and specially during peak rush hours.

description: This is an old school "vecindad" that is close to everything in La Roma, Condesa and Juarez. name: Lovely room in good old Coyoacan (Granate Room)
description:
Our home is a quaint and typical house of old Coyoacan. This bohemian neighborhood is just the perfect place to stay and explore the huge Mexico City. This house holds not only lots of Mexican charm but an artistic family that will make your stay unique. Enjoy our place! Feel welcome!

The space
Ayuntamiento 70 B&B is a charming restored Colonial-Californian home in the middle of the very sought after and historical neighborhood of Mexico City: Coyoacan. It is offering a most dedicated service to all our guests in a clean, organized and secure ambiance. Each room has its own bathroom, quality bedding and linens and each is decorated with attention to the colors and textures of Mexican handicraft. The property is spacious and has terraces, garden, patio, a large living room and an impressive open plan kitchen with dining area.
This house is surrounded with cozy areas with chimney, piano, lots of Mexican handicrafts a small dance studio...meditation sessions a
host_about: I am madly in love with my good old Mexico and all its charm. I direct a youth ballet company (Ballet Joven ) so dance, music, culture and cats are my sort of things. Welcome to Coyoacan, you will be delighted! Bienvenidos!

neiborhood_overview: Coyoacan is a place to be immediately immersed in culture, color and tradition. By simply walking through its plazas and small cobbled streets you step back in time. The location could not be better with its museums, squares, churches, markets and that special ambience of old colonial grandeur and indigenous charm that Coyoacan proudly presents. With the advantage of our close metro station you can get to the centre of Mexico City and experience all the wonders of the historic quarters, the museum areas, the vast shopping and later return back to the peaceful cobbled streets of good old Coyoacan. It is said that people who live in Coyoacan never wish to leave. I guess our dear Frida Kahlo could not agree more.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the hippest neighborhood in the city full of chef-driven restaurants (like Maximo Bistro), bistros, cafÃ©s, independent shops, and galleries, many housed in French-style mansions from the turn of the 20th century. Intermixed you will still find âa real Mexico City neighborhoodâ with MedellÃ­n market, tortillerÃ­as, corner shops, and retirees reading in the park. Leafy Art Deco Condesa is a few blocks to the west. The historic downtown, Anthropology Museum, and Polanco are each two miles away - a short hop by Uber or try rental bikes, Subway, bus, trolleybus or just walking and exploring!

Roma Norte and surroundings are very, very safe - chock full of pedestrians, doormen, and police. My only âwarningâ would be as in any big city, avoid walking down dark empty streets alone after midnight. Only for walking downtown and other crowded areas (so NOT in Roma) and public transportation I advise: Keep valuables hidden and inaccessible, purses and backpacks close, and do

host_about:
Hi! Im a Canadian living in Mexico for the last 10 years, 5 of those years in Mexico City. 

I'm a very active person, and not home much of the time unless i need to be. I speak many languages and enjoy meeting new people, and helping you enjoy my city. I like to make you feel welcome, and are happy to offer you tips and help you with any questions you may have,

I have been an airbnb superhost before when I lived in Puerto Escondido, Oaxaca, and have decied to open up my apartment here in Mexico City. 
Ilove hosting people in my home, and also know how important it is to respect our guests privacy. 

Look forward to meeting you :)

description:
Cook meals in a warm kitchen with light wood surfaces and a breakfast bar island. Dine alfresco on a spacious roof terrace. After a plunge in the hot tub, retire to an urban living room with hip furnishings and robust brick walls.

Our family will be out of the city for a few months but our lovely friends Lili, Cami and Dania will be living there and will take good care of you during your stay. They are three working professionals who enjoy having new guests :)

Sometimes, we Host events like art workshops, meditations- you are welcome to join in.

Besides the girls there is a friendly dogs.

The space
The accommodation is the only room on the rooftop (two stairs), and it can be accessed by a secondary stair to avoid going through the entire house, making it almost private.

The sommiers can be set up as a king size bed or twin beds.

The room has its own bathroom attached, a minibar, a coffee maker with daily coff
host_about:
Soy un argentino apasionado y aventurero. LleguÃ© a MÃ©xico para un viaje de un mes despuÃ©s de trabajar en la filamaciÃ³n de 5 largometrajes consecutivos y me enamorÃ© de este increÃ­ble paÃ­s, por lo que nunca me fui. I am a passionate and adventurer Argentinean. I came to Mexico for a one-month road trip after working in five feature films shootings in a row and I fell in love with this amazing country, so I never left. Two months later I fell in love again, but this time to one of its beautiful women, and I married Karina. Be aware that if you come to Mexico, you might never leave!

name: Downtown Mexico City! Regina 70
description:
Comfortable apartment at only 4 blocks from the Zocalo of Mexico city, you'll be in the heart of downtown, located in Regina no. 70 low level is a pedestrian street that allows access to a variety of bars and restaurants to spend a pleasant time. It can comfortably accommodate 4 people in a QS bed, a Double sofa bed and an Single sofa bed, it has WiFi, Smart TV, equipped kitchen, dining room, living room and 2 full bathrooms. Welcome, I'm Martha and I'll be happy to meet you!

The space
The apartment is located on the ground floor of a historic building, Regina is a pedestrian street and is 4 blocks from the Zocalo of the CDMX, having a privileged location there is a variety of restaurants and bars to have a great time! In Mexico City the hours of operation of bars and restaurants are until 2:00 am so it may be somewhat noisy on Fridays and Saturdays, I recommend that if you are a light sleeper bring some earplugs in case you need them . The apartment is spacious

name: Bright New-Build Apartment W/high Speed Internet at Condesa
description:
CDC-recommended cleaning.
High speed internet, filtered water and courtesy beverages for welcoming :)
Supermarket literally few steps from apartment.
Coffee, tea and everything you need to have a comfortable stay!!!
Tempur Cloud Breeze KingSize Mattress.

Location above all the things I can say about the apartment. Conveniently located near museums (Anthropology, Tamayo, Modern Art) , public transportation, and Condesa itself. You will find a cozy, luxurious shelter in an amazing, vibrant, colorful city. Close to restaurantes, supermarket, super cute bakery shops, and parks, you will find a great place to rest and enjoy the city inside a truly urban, modern apartment.

Access to complete apartment. It has 2 bedrooms, each one with queen size bed and bathroom with walking closet. Completely equipped kitchen, TV and working area, access to roof garden, and use from 2 spots to park in case you need. High speed internet and TV. Security 24/7.

name: The perfect room in downtown Tlalpan
description:
The perfect room in Downtown Tlalpan. Walking distance to the hospital area. We clean the room and bathroom daily. Daily breakfast included: Fresh cut fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk and coffee.
Big closet and the room is in a beautiful house.

Working area inside the room. Near the quaint area of Downtown Tlalpan. Great restaurants and interesting sites to see.

Extra food and laundry can be settle with the owner.

The space
This area of the city is very quaint and safe. The house is a beautiful one and not crowded. The habitants work all day and are here at weekends.

Guest access
You will be able to use the kitchen, breakfast area, laundry, the down terrace and living room. It is a big house.

Other things to note
You will feel at home.
host_about:
A sensuous life!.
Travelling one of many passions.
My house is a temple,  love to share it with guests and treat them as they deserve. The energy one feels stepping inside the house is one of "nice to be home"
Guess I expect to feel the same, when I travel.  

As a guest I will respect every corner of the house I get in, as I shall expect the guests that stay at my house do the same -when staying at my place-.

Love to:
Eat, enchanting places, art, 
to read and a movie freak.

My favorite destinations are the cities that have tons to tell. Europe and Eastern Europe are my favorite destinations. Asia, blows my mind. When I travel to Asia, I would probably stay in one of the best venues. History is part of my life so as long as the destination has historical links, it will probably fit in this category. To be in contact with nature, but mostly the beach.

name: Cozy guest room in HipÃ³dromo Condesa quiet area
description:
This is a beautiful designer's home situated amongst tree-lined streets in the upscale neighborhood of Condesa.
We are a couple of guys and a dog living in an apartment with eclectic style decor. Our place is located nearby the best coffee shops and restaurants of the area/city and you even can hear bird chirping outside the window in the mornings. We speak fluent spanish, french and english. People from all over the world is welcome in our place.

The space
The room is spacey, queen bedroom and desk. The apartment has large rooms, service room and kitchen. The building has an elevator, a 24/7 doorman, nearby coffee shops and restaurants. Quiet and easy to get transportation.

Guest access
Access to both bathrooms, kitchen, service room with laundry, living room and dining room.

Other things to note
Our dog Canija is a senior, mellow small english bull terrier. She likes to gossip and sleep.

name: Roomy condo w/roofgarden near Coyoacan downtown
description:
Roomy and comfortable condominium, at walking distance from the Coyoacan cultural center. Located in a beautiful area in Mexico City, the place is suitable for families with children, pets, groups of friends or couples looking for a short-to-long stay with a wide range of amenities. Around the neighbourhood, you'll find parks, museums, (super)markets, theatres, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc., as well as a wide choice of transportation around the city.

The space
The place has two bedrooms, each with its own full bathroom. The main bedroom has a double bed and large closet and shower. The second room has a bunk bed (with a bottom double bed and a top single bed), a medium closet, a foldable elliptical (for exercise) and a medium shower. The living room, dinning room and working space occupy a large room, clear and illuminated, for kids or pets to play. name: Classic 1930's Condesa house with beautiful patio
description:
Classic two-floor Condesa house from the 1930's, in one of the most iconic streets in the neighborhood, away from the bustle yet close to restaurants / bars and a stone's throw from the famous Condesa parks.
The house is spacious and bright, with a lovely functional kitchen (w/breakfast table) and a cool living room, both connecting with a beautiful patio yard surrounded by plants, ideal for disconnecting. There's an elegant dining room, two confortable bedrooms and two full art decÃ³ bathrooms.

The space
We love living in this house, and only rent it when we're away on vacation. Thus, we try to make it as enjoyable as possible.
To quote some of our past guests, "an absolute gem of a home!, the architecture is breathtaking and the decor is perfect", "it was even more than expected", "the apartment was big and had everything we needed, the patio in the backyard was fantastic for breakfast and to just relax in the afternoon", "great location".
host_about: We're a multicultural couple based in Mexico City who love nature. We really enjoy travelling, visiting new places to meet people, other cultures, and experience new food.

host_about:
Welcome to my world.  IÂ´m a people person and have shared my place with friends from London, Germany, Finland, Japan, Spain, France and USA. 
I am very proud of MexicoÂ´s heritage and cultural background and would love to share it with you. I work as a free lance communication consultant and I also enjoy practicing and teaching meditation and some other ancestral healing traditions. My place is warm, friendly and cozy.  If you choose to stay here I could help you design or optimize your stay in MÃ©xico City and join you or drive you around if you feel like it. If you (Hidden by Airbnb) where my flat is you will see that you are within walking distance from some of the most interesting sites like Chapultepec Castle and Park, Modern Art Museum, The Anthropologic Museum, Tamayo. And you can easily and safely walk move around day or nigh since this is a very privileged area. Wether you choose to stay here or not, I hope you have an amazing time while in Mexico.

name: Passion and Colors of Mexico
description:
We prepared Passion and Colors to delight visitors from around the world and create unique and memorable experiences. We'll be very happy to host you so you can enjoy the beautiful Coyoacan whether you are on vacations, business or visiting your family.

Sincerely,
Silvia, Cris & Omar

The space
The building where our apartment is located has 24 hour surveillance staff and closed circuit television in common areas; Additionally, we have a doorbell with camera at the entrance of the apartment for additional safety and tranquility of our guests.

We offer free parking in the building for small to medium size cars or compact SUV; in case your car is bigger, do not worry, we can provide you with a free and safe parking space where you can leave your car during your entire stay, which is only 8 minutes walk from the apartment.

Other things to note
It is important to highlight the apartment is NOT shared with other guests
host_about:
My name is Omar. Iâm proudly Mexican and have lived my life in the beautiful Coyoacan that is located in the south part of Mexico City.

I love to travel the world with my beautiful wife Silvia, meet new people, cultures, cuisine, and experience with extreme adventures from time to time.

My wife and I are wine & tequila lovers, we also enjoy spending time with our relatives, friends and play with our cat Mr. Jinks; my hobbies are technology, rock music, playing the guitar, bowling, video games, and swimming.

I love hosting and meeting new people, networking with other hosts, learn from the Hospitality experts, interact with our local and global host communities as well as truly love coaching and training hosts to help them thrive in the hosting journey!

Hospitality our passion so we will be very delighted to receive guest and visitors from our lovely Mexico and all around the world making sure they always have an unforgettable and unique stay experience at our cozy spaces.


Hola, mi nombre es Omar, soy orgullosamente Mexicano y he vivido toda mi vida en CoyoacÃ¡n al sur de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico.
 
Me encanta viajar con mi bella esposa Silvia, conocer nuevas personas, culturas, gastronomÃ­a y experimentar nuevas aventuras extremas de vez en cuando.
 
Silvia y yo somos amantes del vino y el Tequila, disfrutamos pasar tiempo con nuestros parientes, amigos y jugar con nuestro gato Mr. Jinks; mis pasatiempos son la tecnologÃ­a, la mÃºsica rock, tocar la guitarra, los bolos y los videojuegos y la nataciÃ³n.
 
Me apasiona ser anfitriÃ³n y conocer gente nueva de todo el mundo, aprender de los expertos en hospitalidad y la industria de las estancias a corto plazo, pero sobre todo me fascina enseÃ±ar y compartir mis conocimientos con nuestras comunidades locales y globales de Anfitriones.

La hospitalidad es nuestra pasiÃ³n, por eso estaremos encantados de recibir huÃ©spedes y visitantes de nuestro hermoso MÃ©xico y de todo el mundo para que siempre tengan una experiencia Ãºnica e inolvidable en nuestros lindos espacios.

neiborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located in Coyoacan which is in the south part of Mexico City.

The Historic Center of Coyoacan is an intellectual and bohemian neighborhood that is only 15 minutes by car from the apartment, there you can find excellent cafes, restaurants, bars, museums, colonial churches, popular markets, Mexican handcrafts and access to the turistic train and bus. This makes this place unique and a must go when visiting Mexico City.

In the surroundings of Coyoacan are several museum options such as the National Museum of Interventions, the Anahuacalli Museum (Diego Rivera's studio), the National Museum of Watercolor, the House of Leon Trotsky Museum, the Frida Kahlo Museum (The Blue House), the University Museum of Contemporary Art and the University Cultural Center.

Lastly, the headquarters of educational institutions in Mexico, such as the UNAM and the Autonomous Metropolitan University (UAM) and the majestic Azteca Stadium are also located in Coyoa

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia CuauhtÃ©moc is a colonia (official neighborhood) in the CuauhtÃ©moc municipality of central Mexico City. It is located just north of Paseo de la Reforma, west of the historic center of Mexico City.

The colonia was created in the late 19th century after some false starts, and is named after the Monument to CuauhtÃ©moc which is a nearby landmark on Paseo de la Reforma. Actions taken by residents have ensured that the area remains mostly residential, with commercial development limited to the strip along Paseo de la Reforma. This strip includes a number of important buildings such as the Mexican Stock Exchange, the Torre Mayor, the Torre HSBC, the British Embassy, and the United States Embassy.
