name: Trendy, Light-Filled Flat in Artsy Neighborhood
description:
Explore Mexico City's eclectic streets with this impeccably-designed apartment as your base. The light-filled flat features Aztec-inspired accents and mid century furnishings, giving the property a straight-out-of-a-magazine feel.

Our modern home is situated on an upper floor of a brand-new modern apartment building right in the middle of the trendy Roma and Condesa neighborhoods.

Master bedroom: Queen-sized bed, Floor-to-ceiling windows, an in-room bathroom/shower with a built-in bluetooth shower speaker, large closet, 49" 4K HDTV Roku TV with Netflix and Cable, balcony overlooking the city.

2nd bedroom: Queen-sized bed, large closet, adjacent bathroom/shower.

Kitchen: Brand new 6-burner stove and oven, Ninja blender, toaster, microwave, complete dishware/cookware, full knife set, Mr. Coffee coffee maker, water heater, mixing bowls, large fridge/freezer, water filter, coffee, tea, spices, bar seating.

Living/Dining Room: 6-person
host_about:
Hey! I'm Sagiv. After traveling the world for a while, I moved to Mexico City in December 2017 and fell in love with the city. I'm an investment analyst by day, and In my free time I like boxing and diving. 

You can also find me checking out museums, going on hikes, and attending concerts and shows around the city. Happy to give recommendations!

I speak English, Hebrew, and a bit of Spanish.

Cheers!

The apartment is located in Condesa, which is the vibrant and modern part of the city. Just a foot step away, there are many trendy restaurants. You will find everything from a traditional taqueria (typical Mexican tacos) to a high end modern fusion cuisne.
If you enjoy parks to walk or for the morning jog, "Parque Mexico" and "Parque EspaÃ±a" are in less than 5 minutes walking distance.
One great thing about Condesa is also that at night you can find everything from a hip alternative bar, or a fancy place to take out a date.
Taxis are relatively cheap in Mexico and available 24hours. If you prefer to use local transportation (Metro + Bus), big stations are also less than 5 minutes walking distance away.
At CasaCorp you come as a stranger and leave as a friend!

Guest access
host_about:
I am from Mexico, studied Architecture. Mainly into interior architecture.
I love art and own an Art Gallery ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) I design and manufacture fine furniture and have a showroom.
Love to travel and meet people, 
I enjoy a nice bottle of wine specially sharing with great people.
Love to play tennis and practice  alpine  ski.

name: 2 Bedroom Condesa suite with patio
description:
Recently remodeled very well-located first floor flat between two lovely parks in popular neighbourhood, La Condesa. Lots of bars, restaurants, kids play parks, free public gyms, boutique shops, galleries, malls, cinemas, museums, markets and supermarkets all within walking distance. Close to both Metro Sevilla and Sonora Metrobus stop. Ideal for couples, families, groups of friends and professionals. Two rooms with queen-size beds, comfy open plan dining & living area with good size patio

The space
The apartment is on the 1st floor and has two good-sized bedrooms with a large closet in each one. It also has a sofa bed in the living room. Each bedroom has its own lock for privacy. The communal areas include the kitchen/dining room/living-room and the two bathrooms.

There is no elevator so is not ideally suited to anyone with mobility issues.

Please note there is no guest parking available within the building. There are parking meters in

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the 'trendiest' areas in Mexico City and also one of the safest. It's full of great wee places to explore on foot including a wealth of bars, restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops.
Parque MÃ©xico and EspaÃ±a are great for wandering around or exercising - both have free open air gym facilities and jogging tracks - and are the perfect option if you have kids as they both have excellent play parks and are just 100 meters from the apartment.
If you fancy a bit more of an adventure the massive Chapultepec park is just 1km away, it's brilliant for running, walking, cycling or visiting the museums and huge free zoo inside it.
Roma neighbourhood is also just a stone's throw away which is another great neighbourhood, that's where you'll find Mercado Medellin, our favourite market for all things food related.

name: Minimalist urban apartment in Polanco
description:
The apartment is wonderful; as you come inside you will be immersed in a complete comfort atmosphere. The furniture and decoration are chosen to delight. The peaceful bedroom is characterized by high ceilings, king size bed with luxury bedding and a huge 4k TV with Netflix. The living room and dining room are perfect to relax and recharge energies after a busy day in Mexico City.
The space consists of one bedroom with a king size bed with it's own independent complete bathroom. An extra half bathroom for visits, a spacious living room, dining room and an open kitchen. All spaces have natural light and natural ventilation.
Wifi is available in all the apartment. Feel free to use the washing and drying machine every time you need. Cleaning service fee is requested to leave everything impecable for our next guest at the end of your stay. If you need additional cleaning during your stay, you may ask for it with an additional US$20 fee.

All guests are more than welcome.
host_about:
Hello! My name is Liliana.

I'm a host & traveler.

I'm an architect. I love getting to know new cities, new buildings, and different ways of design.

If I stay in your place, be confident I will take care of it as I take care of mine. 

If you stay in mine, I will attend every detail and I'll make sure you have a pleasant stay.

description:
Both hosts are now vaccinated.

Bright, calm, and quiet room for 2 with queen bed and private bathroom in apartment building in one of the most exclusive areas of Mexico City, the Polanco neighborhood.

Strict social distancing inside our property, as well as face mask use. We ask all guests to sanitize themselves upon entering. Full sanitization is performed after every checkout. Lysol and hand sanitizer available in room.

The space
We are an elderly (vaccinated) retired diplomat couple looking to receive travelers from all around the world, who are searching for a cozy and quiet place to stay in for your business or leisure trips to Mexico City.

We are fluent in Spanish and English and intermediate in French.

The room we've made for you is very quiet and calm, great for two. It's very bright with the curtains open, but also very dark when closed, great for a long and refreshing sleep. We recently purchased bed clothing
host_about: As most people here, traveling is a key part of my life. Finding new places to visit is a challenge with so many options nowadays. Finding a great place to stay in is also important and I love to experience what each host has to offer, of course respecting their property and rules.

neiborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is in one of the most exclusive areas of Mexico City (Polanco). Only two blocks away from Masaryk Avenue

Lots of restaurants, bars, cafes, pubs to choose from. Shops, services, grocery stores, malls, movie theaters, museums, parks, plazas, clubs, street food, and much more. Also close to Reforma Avenue (the biggest avenue of Latin America). All at a walking distance.

Morning and afternoons are heavy in transit and pedestrians. Nights are very calm and quiet.

Safety, the neighborhood is one of the safest in the city.
